A red tip and orange sides make the toucan’s bill stand out from the surrounding foliage. Extensive trails run like veins through the jungle allowing for hikes spanning an hour to multiple days. Victoria Peak, the highest mountain in Belize, rises to 3,675 feet above sea level and looms above the sanctuary. Your guide points out fresh jaguar tracks in the ground. Although you find signs of recent activity, jaguars are masters of stealth. The leaves rustle around the tall lowland evergreen trees. Your heart pounds with excitement and fear as you wonder if a jaguar will jump out of the brush. Instead, you find a paca, a large rodent with stripes and dots on its back. It resembles a large, shorthaired guinea pig. A paca can grow up to 20 inches in length and with a cone-shaped body. They feed on fallen fruits from fallen trees and the underbrush. The kids can’t look enough, marveling at the natural wildlife almost close enough to touch.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Finding Mayans
dayInfo.description: The culture of Belize runs deep, from slaves escaping colonial era ships to Mayan architecture towering above the treetops. You meet your private transfer in the lobby and make your way south to the Toledo District near Punta Gorda. The road takes you inland through the canopy before you reach the Mayan city of Nim Li Punit. The site is most known for the large amount of stele, upright stone slabs bearing inscriptions or relief designs, discovered at the site. The largest stela depicts a man wearing a large headdress, capturing the image of an ancient king. Your guide leads you through the former Mayan city that flourished between the 5th century AD and the 8th century AD. Structures surround three main plazas, including a 40-foot tall step pyramid. The architectural feat causes the entire family to stop in awe. The visitor center provides a stunning view from the ridge looking out to the southern coastal plains. The white stones demarcating the road disappear beneath the jungle canopy. You walk among the terraces and hill slopes the Mayan utilized to create platforms and outline the plazas. Archeologists excavated three tombs in the residential area, connoting the site as the Plaza of the Royal Tombs. The kids want to run around the ball court located at the midpoint of the city. Two mounds frame a sunken rectangular court. Although the no one knows the rules of the game, the movement of the ball represented the sun, moon, and other astronomical bodies.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Searching the Laughing Bird
dayInfo.description: The morning on Placencia always feels tranquil and inviting. You wake up as eager as the kids to see what adventure the new day brings. Today you make your way to Laughing Bird Caye, an island 11 miles off the Placencia coast. The national park spreads across nearly two acres, named for the laughing gull that breeds on the island. When the gull calls out, it sounds like a chortle. When you arrive on the island shores, you find pelicans roosting on the thatched-roof huts. White sand spreads across the beaches. Coconut trees tower above the inland walkways. Mangrove roots sprawl into the saltwater providing a balanced ecosystem where fish feed and anemones cling to the sturdy submerged sections of the tree. The park is divided into three zones: the recreational zone, buffer zone, and the preservation zone. Your guide provides a presentation of the park by way of a brief introduction. You and the family step into your kayaks and follow your guide along the crystal clear, tepid water. The nearby Barrier Reef ensures a gentle current around the mini-atoll. Water splashes into your vessel when you paddle. The pristine beauty of Belize radiates both above and below the water, from the parrotfish around the coral to the green heron soaring near the treetops.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – The Joys of Leisure
dayInfo.description: The Placencia Peninsula provides ample opportunity for adventure and relaxation. In the morning, you let the sea breeze brush against your cheeks and remember you are on vacation. Today is at the family’s discretion to continue with exciting excursions around the peninsula or indulge in a few moments of relaxation. Belize’s only bowling alley, Jaguar Lanes, is situated nearby. The four-lane alley also has a café serving pizza and wings to accompany the fun-filled time bowling. You could also make another expedition to a Mayan site, this time visiting Lubaantun, the largest Mayan establishment in Southern Belize. During the months of March and June, you choose to take the kids on an unforgettable adventure snorkeling with whale sharks. The water continues to beckon to the family with its reflective surface and inviting temperature. The colors of the Barrier Reef glint beneath the water’s surface. The sunlight can penetrate the clear sea more than 200 feet deep. You make your way to Gladden Split, a unique environment where whale sharks swim near large schools of fish. Your guide explains that divers and snorkelers are required to maintain a distance of 10 feet at all times. You venture into the turquoise water in search of the mammoth creatures. The shark can grow to more than 40 feet long, holding the record as the largest non-mammalian vertebrate in the animal kingdom. When clarity at Gladden Spit is good, you can see between 33 and 98 feet in front of you. The outline of the whale shark forms in the distance. Its grand size is unmistakable.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – An Endless Family Adventure
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you sink into the luxury the refreshing sea breeze once more. The sound of the waves crashing on the beach sounds sweeter on your last morning in Belize. The kids imitate the calls of the howler monkeys, a sound no one in the family is likely to forget. You have collected the splendor of Placencia in the form of memories, spending indelible moments with your family in the jungle and the Caribbean Sea. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts the family to the Placencia airport for your quick flight to Belize City. You land at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport with plenty of time to check-in for your flight home.

tourName: A Romantic Belize Getaway: Beauty & Luxury in Paradise
placesVisited: San Ignacio, Ambergris Caye
generalInfo: In Belize, you can escape into the seclusion of the jungle and submerse yourself in the splendor of the Caribbean Sea. Listen to the birds call to one another in the morning light. Witness the towering stones of Mayan temples. Sharks and manta rays wade their way along the sea floor near sparkling coral reefs. Traverse the depths of a deep cavern following in the footsteps of Mayan customs. You and your partner find the perfect blend of adventure and relaxation, privacy and romance during your custom tailored dream vacation in Belize.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Lush Seclusion in the Cayo District
dayInfo.description: Belize has a scintillating combination of tropical jungle and seaside, Mayan culture and Caribbean lifestyle. Your flight lands at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport in Belize City. A brief, small flight takes you to the Cayo District on the banks of the Mopan and Macal Rivers. Verdant trees rise around the runway. The aroma of berries and tree bark fill the air. On the hillside, you see cows grazing on the hillside through the trees. Your private transfer meets you at baggage claim and takes you along the narrow, gravel-paved road to your award-winning resort. Your concierge greets you and your partner with freshly squeezed juice made from berries grown on the property’s organic farm. You are given a refreshing peppermint towel. You press the cool, fragrant fabric to your neck, which offsets the temperate jungle humidity. A steward takes your bags to your room. From your suite, you can hear the trickling waters of the Macal River running along the banks to towards the foothills of the Maya Mountains. The property encompasses 400-acres and includes a private nature reserve and butterfly farm. You and your partner easily settle into the romantic ambiance set in the jungle’s lushness.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Romance in History at Xunantunich
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you wake up to the rushing water along the Macal River. Birds chirp in the canopy around the edges of the property. Trogons thrive in the subtropical forest. Their calls consist of monosyllabic whistles and hoots. At breakfast, you sit beneath the thatched-roof open to the natural beauty surrounding the property. You and your partner indulge in an organic meal cooked by a celebrated chef, accompanied by a freshly brewed cup of coffee. After breakfast, you meet your guide at the stables. A number of horses roam freely across the property, rounded up only when guests wish to enjoy time along the trails on horseback. You and your partner saddle-up and make your way along a tranquil, secluded trail to the Mayan site of Xunantunich. You trot through broadleaf forest finding traces of howler monkeys along the way. Your guide points to the discarded shells of tree nuts on the forest floor. You arrive at Xunantunich, which means Stone Woman in the Yucatec Maya language, and dismount your horse. The core of the site encompasses nearly 3230 square feet. More than 26 temples and palaces surround a total of six plazas. El Castillo stands at the heart of the main plaza. It was erected in 800 AD and stands 130 feet tall. It is one of the tallest buildings in Belize. The pyramid stands beneath a series of terraces. Friezes depict the birth of a god connected to the royal family, along with various versions of creation, including the tree of life. Your guide explains that the tree is significant because the roots touch the underworld, the stump remains on earth, and the branches reach to the heavens. You and your partner find shared splendor in the mythology and history of the ancient site.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Beauty of the Blue
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the water from the infinity pool drips into a lower pond, acting as a fountain. The sound accentuates the verdant atmosphere and nearby river. After breakfast, your transfer meets at the lobby and takes you along the Hummingbird Highway. The forest vegetation opens to citrus groves along the roadside. Oranges and limes add a fruity aroma to the jungle ambiance. You pass the entrance to Cockscomb Wildlife Sanctuary and Jaguar Preserve and soon arrive at the entrance to Blue Hole National Park. You follow the trail to a stairway leading you through the forest. Birds twitter in the treetops, but the landscape is otherwise quiet creating the feeling of privacy. A bright, sapphire blue glows through the foliage. Sunlight beams through the treetop and reflects off the water’s surface, making the pool look more like glass. Blue-crowned marmots take reprieve on the vines. Their colorful tail feathers dangle like tassels. The sinkhole was formed after an underground limestone cave collapsed. The surface water is located approximately 100 feet below the surrounding jungle. The pool drops another 25 feet into the underground cave system. You and your partner dip your toes into the water first. The subterranean temperature contrasts the warm forest providing a refreshing, sensual touch.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Adventure Together
dayInfo.description: In the early light of the morning, butterflies flutter around the farm located on the property. A local guide is happy to show visitors the life cycle of the butterfly, from the pale green egg stage to the dazzling indigo colors radiating from its wings. After breakfast, your private guide meets you in the lobby once again, eager to take you on a fabulous adventure to the Barton Creek Caves. Mayans once used the caverns for ceremonial purposes. You and your partner step into a canoe and make your way along the quiet, emerald waters. Your guide paddles close-by, explaining the natural history of the region and the cultural heritage of the caves. Stalactites dangle from the cave opening resembling an open mouth with teeth. Vines from the growing trees wrap around the textured cliff. The sunlight fades. You turn on your headlamps to see the width of the cavern and its cathedral-like qualities. The air is cool. When you touch the walls, you find the slick surface as cold as the temperature. Stalactites drip down to head level. You and your partner weave around them. You can hear water dripping into the subterranean river. Your guide points to Mayan pottery shards almost overtaken by the earth. The cave travels nearly 21,000 feet through the mountain. In 2005, an exploration team found the cave to meander almost four miles deep. You couldn’t imagine a better way to explore a subterranean river system than with your partner, listening to the water ripple.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – One More Taste of the Jungle
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the breakfast has a succulent and invigorating aroma. Roasted coffee and fresh fruits bring a bitter and sweet scent to the jungle air. After your meal, you could spend time enjoying the property or visit the town of San Ignacio. At Branch Mouth, you can see the meeting of the Mopan and Macal Rivers. The Mopan travels from Guatemala from Mountain Pine Ridge. The confluence marks the beginning of the Belize River, which flows out to sea along the northeast of the country. Before you make your way to the airport, you and your partner decide to take part in a couple’s Mayan cooking class. The roots of the heritage remain strong throughout Central America. You meet your instructor ready for a spellbinding experience on the doorstep of ancient Mayan cities. The tradition of the cuisine emanates through the cooking process. You use a stone rolling pin to shape maize, learning how to make fresh tortillas first and foremost. You can hear them sizzle as they cook on the stone pan, set atop a roaring fire. After your class, your private transfer escorts you to the local airport for your flight to Belize City. You board another brief flight to San Pedro on Ambergris Caye, where you indulge in your seaside suite overlooking the gentle waves splashing against the white sand.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Submerging into Splendor
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can stand on your private balcony and enjoy a morning drink while looking out onto the water. A pier juts out from the beach pointing in the direction of the horizon. Boats speed by in the distance. A sailboat catches the breeze and cruises along the turquoise water. After breakfast, you make your way to the jetty to meet your skipper and venture out on a private snorkeling excursion. You catch the aroma of the salty, sweet ocean. Your guide explains the reason for the variation in blue hues, ranging from crystal clear indigo to cobalt, depending on the depth of the ocean floor. After a brief journey, you arrive at your first snorkel location, Mexico Rocks. The section is located in a shallows midway between the Barrier Reef and Ambergris Caye, reaching a maximum depth of 12 feet. You follow your guide floating above the coral. Brain coral, named for its meandering ridges resembling a brain, grow out of the sand. Sea fans wave in the drifting current. The visibility allows you to see up to 30 feet in front of you. A large spiny lobster peeks out from beneath the coral crests. Their long, thin, spiny antennae differentiate the lobster from other closely related groups. In the distance, your guide points out the shell of a green turtle swimming quickly away. The spectacular show beneath the water is something you and your partner will always share.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – A Time for Relaxation
dayInfo.description: The mornings on Ambergris Caye are relaxed and tranquil. A local fruit market set beneath a thatched roof located alongside the main road displays lush, local produce for passersby. Pineapple and mangoes add to the illustrious colors of the island. The day is yours to enjoy San Pedro, Ambergris Caye, and the surrounding islands as you and your partner desire. Learn a new sport with a kitesurfing lesson, using the breeze to lift you and the board from the water for seconds at a time. Step aboard a catamaran for an unforgettable sailing adventure taking you around the islands. You and your partner can spend time together at the spa, taking in a romantic couple’s massage. You step out into the serene setting along the pier. The water brushes against the support posts below. The scent of the sea blends with the coconut aroma of the room, with an open view to the horizon. You and your partner lay side by side listening to the soothing sounds of the shore. You both relax instantly, enjoying the feeling of all your tension washing away. You forget about the life waiting for you off the island and find yourself embracing the present with your partner, indulging in island life.

dayInfo.title: Belize City – Romance from Here, There, and Back Again
dayInfo.description: In the morning, can’t help but recall the romantic beach dinner you and your partner shared the previous evening. You sat at a table on the beach looking out to the water and listening to the waves. You sipped champagne, dug your toes into the sand, and felt like you arrived at your own private beach separate from the rest of the world. Today you relive that sensation at breakfast, enjoying a savory meal accompanied by the pleasant aromas of papaya and banana. When you are ready, your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to the San Pedro airport for your brief flight to Belize City. You land at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport with plenty of time to check-in to your flight home. You prepare for your departure, knowing that you will soon return to Belize to soak in more of the romance beneath the jungle trees and along the white sand shores.

tourName: Amazing Tropical Vacation to Belize: Explore, Relax, and Indulge
placesVisited: Belize City, Placencia Peninsula, San Ignacio, Caye Caulker
generalInfo: White beaches, Maya ruins, monkey-dappled trails, and a surreal world that is hidden beneath the ground are all yours to explore during this 10-day tropical tour of Belize. Belize is a sultry hangout that mixes the best of the Caribbean with the beautiful jungles. With one foot in the sea and one in the rainforest, you can explore one of the world’s emerging destinations with this handcrafted itinerary. Belize offers a tropical vacation with an array of surprises, so you can escape to a beach paradise and immerse yourself in the local culture.

dayInfo.title: Belize City – Surprises of the City
dayInfo.description: Most visitors to Belize land in the capital and then head straight out to their destinations, but you will have the chance to explore Belize City with an engaging guide. Sure, the city is a little rough around the edges, but that only adds to its authenticity. You will touch down at the country’s main international airport and transfer to your boutique hotel on the waterfront. Here, you may be treated to pods of dolphins in the water. You can spend the afternoon with your guide, walking around the highlights of the capital.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Wandering Quiet Beaches
dayInfo.description: Placencia soothes the soul and is easy on the eye. Today, you will fly here from Belize City. Here, you will be staying at a private villa on a strip of sand. It is easy to spend the day not doing anything but basking on the beach and taking a stroll along the white sand. When out walking, you can dip into the mangroves or explore one of the tiny fishing hamlets around the peninsula. There are options to take a boat tour, and there is great snorkeling available within a short walk of your villa.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Laughing Bird Caye National Park
dayInfo.description: Birds and marine life will fill your day at Laughing Bird Caye National Park. Today, you will embark on a boat trip to the park, where you will be met by squawking birds, pelicans, and laughing gulls. You can explore the land and discover rare birds, including ospreys and green herons. You can then indulge in a stroll through the mangroves with your guide, where you might find some nesting sites. You will then return to the shoreline and swim out from the beach with a mask and snorkel. After a break for lunch, you can snorkel at an offshore reef and descend from your boat into the water.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Maya Culture and the Lubaantun Ruins
dayInfo.description: Monkey River provides a classic safari experience. Here, you can sit back in the boat and watch the wilderness unfold. Howler monkeys can be heard before they are seen. You may spot them in the treetops and wonder how such a relatively small primate can make such a loud noise. After an early breakfast, you will set off on a boat safari through the mangroves. After Monkey River, you can spend the rest of your morning in a small Maya village. It is not a magnificent ruined city, but rather, it is a living village that continues to preserve traditions. Here, you can share stories, take photos, eat lunch, and learn about life in the rainforest before continuing to the Maya ruins of Lubaantun.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Immersed in the Rainforest
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly from the coast to the rainforest. You will land in San Ignacio, where your eco-lodge has its own private stretch of the wild. Iguanas are common here, and you will find out more at a nearby iguana conservation project. Self-guided hikes can lead you far into the rainforest with monkeys and other wildlife. In the evening, you can bask on your balcony and listen to nature’s lullaby. At your lodge, monkeys, birds, and distant howlers are the sounds that will surround your first night at the lodge.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Xunantunich and Barton Creek
dayInfo.description: Xunantunich is arguably Latin America’s most underrated ruins. The complex architecture belies its age with intimate details that make it hard to believe that the city was built more than 1,300 years ago. Most of the stories cannot be proven, but there is some evidence to suggest that Xunantunich flourished twice with a period of abandonment in between. Unlike some Latin American archaeological sites, you can climb the highest ruins at Xunantunich and ascend the moss-covered temple steps to the second-tallest building in Belize. After lunch, you can spend the afternoon canoeing through Barton Creek Cave.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Into the Maya Underworld
dayInfo.description: A sand-encrusted skeleton waits eerily within Actun Tunichil Muknal, which is believed to have been a sacrificial offering site. Other spooky artifacts showcase how the cave was used by the Mayas. It is quite an adventure just to get here, and you may need to swim across rivers and hike into wild canyons. The remoteness also hints at the Maya underworld, which is suggestive of a site that was deliberately far from main cities. For the most part, you travel by boat, and your spotlight will illuminate the Maya inscriptions in the cave walls. Other skeletal remains can be seen in addition to the raw beauty of the subterranean rainforest landscape.

dayInfo.title: Caye Caulker – Caribbean Beach Life
dayInfo.description: Today, you will circle back to the Caribbean and fly to San Pedro on Ambergris Caye. Upon landing, you will have a boat transfer to Caye Caulker. Smaller and even quieter than its neighbor islet, Caye Caulker fulfills all the promise of the Caribbean. Turquoise water, soft white beaches, and palm trees are just some of the highlights that you can expect. Tourism developed first on Ambergris Caye, and it is only in the last few years that luxury developments have been brought to Caye Caulker. Your boutique guesthouse can be found on the quiet side of the island, although you will only be a casual walk away from excellent seafood restaurants and sundowner bars.

dayInfo.title: Caye Caulker – Snorkeling Expedition
dayInfo.description: Snorkeling with sharks is safe, and it is also exhilarating. You can watch for nurse and reef sharks, which are incredibly iconic in shape. Rays are also plentiful here, although they are harder to find because they move with cunning. Shark Ray Alley is the most famous snorkeling destination in Belize, and today’s day trip will begin here before transferring to two other snorkeling spots in the Hol Chan Nature Reserve. The underwater excursions will be guided, and you will rarely need to swim. Instead, the Caribbean currents will pull you around the reefs.

dayInfo.title: Caye Caulker – Helicopter Flight
dayInfo.description: It is the eclectic array of colors that make the Great Blue Hole special. The hole is deep, blue, dark, and eerie. Small sandy islets provide incredible views, and you will be able to see the collections of coral that form the largest reef in the Northern Hemisphere. A helicopter sightseeing flight will be an excellent way to experience the landscape. The pilot will circle around the Great Blue Hole so that you can get an uninterrupted view. All of the seats are window seats, and the flight will last for about an hour. Once you touch down after your morning flight, the rest of the day will be at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Caye Caulker – Departure
dayInfo.description: Your vacation will be over, although there will still be the chance for some adventure as you take a speed boat back to Ambergris Caye before a 15-minute flight across the sea to Belize City. You will then transfer to the international airport, where you should have time to stop for some shopping before you leave.

tourName: An Exciting Off the Beaten Path Vacation to Guatemala and Belize
placesVisited: Antigua, Lake Atitlan, Chichicastenango, Tikal, Flores, Placencia, Monkey River, Great Belize Barrier Reef
generalInfo: Introduce the family to authenticity, luxury, and adventure in Guatemala and Belize. Dramatic pyramids tower over the jungle canopy as angelfish dart around branching coral in the Caribbean Sea. Women weave delicate garments in great detail alongside coffee farms that flourish in the highlands growing out of the volcanic soil. The bright plumage of tropical birds glows against the jade leaves. Your customized vacation tour takes you from the colonial charm of Antigua to the sensational sandy shores of Placencia, encompassing lakeshores and coastline, ziplines and cultural markets, immersing families of all sizes in the captivating variety of Guatemala and Belize.

dayInfo.title: Antigua – Arrive in Guatemala City and Transfer to Colonial Antigua
dayInfo.description: The family arrives at La Aurora International Airport in Guatemala City. The kids marvel at the peaks outlining the edges of the sprawling cityscape; the mountaintops are volcanic summits creating a stunning skyline around Guatemala’s capital. Your private transfer meets the family at baggage claim and escorts you through the meandering streets of Guatemala City into the highlands. The switchback roads lead you to the cobblestone streets of Antigua as Colonial buildings shine with pastel colors. Three separate volcanic peaks surround the historic city. The Spanish founded Antigua in the 16th century and used it as the capital of the Kingdom of Guatemala for two centuries until a series of earthquakes devastated the area. After you settle into your luxurious hotel, your guide meets you in the lobby for an introductory tour of Antigua and Guatemala. The aroma of freshly made corn tortillas drifts along the streets highlighting the cultural staple of the region. The scent of chocolate spills out of the doors to the Chocolate Museum located on Calle de Arco. The Palace of the Captains-General housed the seat of Spanish colonial government from the building’s completion in 1558, and the restored two-tiered arched façade shows the beauty of the architecture and the grace of the past. Cracks and partially crumbled mortar embody the devastation of earthquakes throughout various historic buildings in the city.

dayInfo.title: Lake Atitlan – Visit Chichicastenango Market en route to Panajachel
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of roasting coffee beans emanates from the hidden courtyards of numerous cafes in Antigua. Exotic birds, from trogons to parakeets, twitter in the vines decorating the patios. After breakfast, meet your private transfer ready to lead you to the town of Chichicastenango. In the early hours of the day, a light mist travels along the ground of the town, creating a mystic ambiance. The sunlight burns away the mist and glints off of the whitewashed walls of the stucco buildings. Eighteen steps symbolize the Mayan calendar and lead to the entrance of the pristine Church of Saint Tomas. Offerings of maize, flowers, and small liquor bottles wrapped in cornhusks speckle the church floor as candles glow in specific patterns along stone platforms filling the gallery. The deep connection with Maya culture embodies the edifice and the traditions connected to the church. On Thursdays and Sundays the town erupts with activity from the bustling marketplace. The main plaza and avenues connecting to the square fills with vendors selling handcrafted goods. Guatemalans from across the country come to buy, sell, or even barter wares. Tin stalls stand beside makeshift wooden stands. Handmade wooden masks depict Maya deities and familiar animal figures. Hand-woven garments, from blouses to tunics, have embroidered flowers and depict small celebratory scenes. The colors of the clothing match the vibrancy of the market. The family gains a unique introduction to the culture of the highlands and the continued connection to tradition.

dayInfo.title: Guatemala City – Discover the Variety of Villages around the Lakeshore
dayInfo.description: Lake Atitlan is an isolated region in the Guatemalan Highlands. Encompassing 50 square miles, and reaching a maximum depth of 1,115 feet, it is the deepest lake in Central America. Rugged ridgelines and towering volcanoes separate the 12 indigenous villages from one another. The water sparkles azure in the rising sunlight. After breakfast, the family reaches the marina where boats drift in the lake’s wake and boards the boat. The kids are eager to visit the towns situated around the lakeside, and the breeze carries the aroma of freshwater. Wildflowers blossom across the lakeshores adding pastel colors to the emerald trees; fishermen paddle across the water in traditional dugout canoes. In San Juan La Laguna, you will find a village with close ties to its Mayan roots. Most of the village speaks Tz’utujil, one of the 23 Mayan dialects recognized in Guatemala. Your guide leads you through the winding streets to the Women’s Weaving Cooperative. Sit with the women who take pride in their work, as they pass down their trade to a new generation of weavers. Follow through the cooperative to learn the traditional dying methods and weaving techniques used by Mayan for generations. After your tour, hike through the coffee fields above the village to a lookout point providing views to San Pedro Volcano.

dayInfo.title: Tikal – Fly from Guatemala City to Flores and Enjoy a Sunset Tour of Tikal
dayInfo.description: Leave Guatemala City in the early morning and fly to the eastern jungle surrounding Flores. Your private transfer meets you at baggage claim at Mundo Maya International Airport and takes you to Ixpanpajul Nature Park. The kids marvel at the hanging bridges and twisting paths meandering through the canopy. You have a look at the dense vegetation of the jungle, which allows the family to get in close contact with the trees, branches, and vibrant birdlife. The six bridges rise more than 320 feet above the forest floor. Orchids bloom in the treetops. Hummingbirds flutter around blossoming flowers. The family has a clear view of the meandering jungle when the canopy opens. For the afternoon, your private transfer escorts the family to your accommodation at Tikal National Park. Your guide will meet you at the visitor center to provide an overview of your tour, and point out the remarkable size of the Mayan city on the scaled diagram. The park encompasses more than six square miles with approximately 3,000 Maya structures. The city flourished around the 8th century AD and continues to inspire visitors from around the world as it rises out of the dense forest. Two acropolises border the Great Plaza; Temples I and II face each other on separate edges of the square. Climb to the top of Temple II, known as the Temple of Masks. Weathered friezes flank the central stairway and provide the temple with its name. 12 main temples decorate the North Acropolis, first erected around the year 100 BC. Your guide leads the family beneath the forest canopy, pointing out the mixture of preserved artifacts, discovered structures, and temples still covered with jungle brush. As the sun begins to set, howler monkeys call out beneath the trees; their rugged cries echo against the stone pyramids. Climb to the top of the tallest pyramid, Pyramid IV, which rises more than 200 feet above the forest floor, and take in the sunset with your family.

dayInfo.title: Placencia ��– Cross into Belize for a Jungle Zipline Tour en route to Placencia
dayInfo.description: Wake up as the kids reenact the calls of the rambunctious howler monkeys, attempting their best impression of the gruff-throated calls. Your private transfer meets the family at your hotel and leads you along the highway to the Belize border. Sporadic villages with grazing cows and clucking chickens line the road to the border. You notice the difference in Belize with towns sprouting along the road leading to the confluence of the Macal and Mopan River before you stop for a thrilling adventure in Belize. The family once again ascends to the treetops, this time ready to make way up to the forest floor on a series of nine zip lines spread across 15 platforms. Travel up to 2,900 feet across the jungle as the wind blows against your body. Imagine that this must be what a bird feels like as the emerald leaves become a streak of greenery passing you by. The kids shriek with delight, once more imitating the howler monkeys from Tikal. When the zip line tour finishes, step back into the van and travel along the Hummingbird Highway to Placencia. The highway is nearly 54 miles long and is the only major roadway connecting east and west Belize. The Maya Mountains run along the horizon. Orange, lime, and banana orchards grow near the road; narrow bridges cross the meandering streams. When you reach Placencia Peninsula, you already feel relaxed as you see the Caribbean Sea splashing against the eastern beaches and the tranquil lagoon to the west lapping at the shore.

dayInfo.title: Placencia - Half-Day Snorkel Tour of the Great Belize Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: Wake up early in the morning to enjoy the wonders of the Caribbean Sea. Small waves crash against the soft sand outside of your resort as palm trees shade the walkway leading across the beach to the lobby. The family boards a small vessel and sails along a string of mangrove-lined islands as the roots of the mangrove trees create a vibrant ecosystem above and below the water. At Laughing Bird Caye, hop off the boat and into the sea. Put on your goggles and snorkel, following your guide along the reef in search of an impressive variety of marine life. The water feels comfortable on your skin. Move easily with the current as angelfish zip around the branching arms of the coral. A large barracuda swims close to the kids; an occasional nurse shark passes beneath your feet swimming closer to the seafloor. The Great Belize Barrier Reef is the second largest unbroken reef in the world, behind the Great Barrier Reef in Australia. Sea fans sprout from the sand and wave in the moving water; conch shells provide an entire habitat for tiny sea creatures. The kids marvel at the entire world living beneath the surface of the sea. In the evening, the family takes part in the Garifuna culture by visiting the town of Seine Bight.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Relish the Culture and Landscape with a Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: Your family has the day to enjoy the splendors of Placencia at your leisure. Relax on the lounge chairs providing opulent views to the vast horizon or dig your toes in the hot sand. You may also take another adventure into the water to explore more of the Barrier Reef. For your family’s final adventure in Belize, you can make your way to Monkey River on a wildlife safari that covers both land and water. The mouth of Monkey River is located at the southern tip of the peninsula. Fishermen travel along small rowboats filled with lobster traps as your captain leads you upstream. The kids point to the crocodiles sunbathing on the banks; iguanas clasp to trees and hide in plain sight. Your guide docks on the secluded jungle banks. Trails lead you through the brush in search of the stunning wildlife that calls the region home. Find signs of deer and tapir tracks as toucans chatter overhead pulling at nuts from the branches. Your guide locates some medicinal plants used by locals for millennia. You find the herbaceous aroma reminiscent of black licorice. When the heat begins to fade, the howler monkeys call to one another once again. Return to the boat, and make your way back to the mouth of the river. Your guide reminds you to keep an eye out for manatees lazing on the shores or swimming in the water. They play around the boat and spit water at one another as you drive past, adding another unforgettable moment to the day.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Come morning and the kids have moved from imitating the howler monkeys to now replicating the sounds of the manatee. The kids’ reaction to the animals proves the adage, “Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.” At breakfast, take one last look at the water to memorize the three layers of blue sparkling in the sunlight. The majesty of Belize and Guatemala have revealed themselves to the entire family, showing a combination of culture, history, and adventure. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to the Placencia Airport for your brief flight to Philip S.W. Goldson Airport in Belize City. After you land, check-in for your flight home, but you could always extend your time in Central America, opting instead to enjoy some island time on Ambergris Caye.

tourName: Belize Culture and Heritage Senior Tour
placesVisited: Ambergris Caye, Placencia, San Ignacio, Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, Tikal
generalInfo: Experience the essence of the Caribbean and the unique histories of the jungle during your customizable 9-day culture and heritage tour to Belize for seniors. Your private excursions with specialist guides will travel at your preferred pace to uncover the unique wonders of Belize’s traditions and preserved customs. From sampling the local cuisine to discovering ancient Mayan ruins hidden in the rainforest, your getaway to Belize offers a majestic introduction to land and sea.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Private Food Tour
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at Ambergris Caye Airport upon your arrival on the island and escort you to the comforts of your luxurious accommodation that overlooks the picturesque Caribbean coastline. You can settle in to the luxurious ambiance of the island before meeting your guide in the lobby for a private immersion into the culinary culture of Belize. Your food tour will lead you to the heart of San Pedro with a guide who is knowledgeable in the variety of cuisine that showcases the diversity of Belize’s culture.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Discover the Culture of the Sea
dayInfo.description: Your guide will greet you at your accommodation and lead you to the dock to begin your discovery of the world’s second-largest barrier reef. You will set out on a boat to enjoy Hol Chan Marine Park. You can follow your guide through the submarine garden near the edge of the Caribbean channel’s slopes, which support more than 160 species of fish. During your tour, you can possibly observe a pod of spotted dolphins, which can grow to over eight feet long and have an abundance of spots. You will continue to Shark Ray Alley, where nurse sharks and manta rays have gathered due to the tradition of fishermen cleaning their fish over the water.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Active Exploration of Ambergris Caye
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will lead you from your accommodation to the American Crocodile Education Sanctuary for a view of the remarkable wildlife that is often overlooked on the lagoon. You will visit with scientists and conservationists who work at the sanctuary to help research, educate, and preserve the crocodile. During your visit, you will witness the American crocodile as they linger in the clear water and watch as your guide wades in the open water to find hatchlings. This will be an interactive experience with some of Belize’s endemic wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Transfer by way of Cockscomb Basin
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have a brief transfer to Belize City in the form of a quick flight. Upon your arrival, your private transfer will meet you at the airport before escorting you to the beauty of Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary and Jaguar Preserve. Your private guide will immerse you in the heritage of the region, which dates back to the ancient Maya, who inhabited the area as early as 10,000 BC. Your guide will also lead you through the wilderness, pointing out the unique vegetation and captivating wildlife that is essential to the micro-ecosystems along the mountain slopes.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – The Wildlife of Monkey River
dayInfo.description: As you travel upriver with your guide this morning, you will discover the treasures of the wilderness around Belize, including manatees that frequent the estuary. Manatees can grow to nearly 10 feet long and weigh over 1,200 pounds. They typically feed off plants and roots found in the mixture of salt and freshwater. Your boat will drop anchor at a small path, where your guide will lead you beneath the emerald canopy of the rainforest in search of a troop of howler monkeys.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Local Food and Cooking Tour
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at your hotel in the morning and escort you to your luxurious accommodation near the jungle town of San Ignacio. Your luxurious resort will be nestled into the beauty of the surrounding greenery and will offer a unique perspective of the canopy, culture, and ecosystem of the Macal River. Your tour for the day will immerse you in the sensational flavors of Belize, beginning with a chocolate tour that will explore the beginnings of the cacao bean in the Mayan tradition, which led to the contemporary organic movement. Your culinary tour of Belize will then continue with a private cooking class near San Ignacio.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – The Heritage of Mayan Xunantunich
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private guide will whisk you to the jungle terrain of Belize to discover the captivating ruins of Xunantunich, which is one of the most popular Mayan sites in the country. You will cross the Mopan River on a hand-operated ferry, which will make the ruins seem much more secluded. The main plateau once hosted 25 temples and palaces, culminating in the soaring figure of El Castillo. Stucco friezes depict a variety of images, including the birth god and the intricate tree of life. The top of the pyramid offers a spectacular panoramic view of Belize’s tropical beauty with the rushing waters of the Mopan River, the banks of the Macal River, and the sweeping greenery of the Belize River Valley.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Full Day Excursion to Tikal
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will meet you at the hotel and lead you deep into the jungle terrain, crossing the border into Guatemala for an excursion to Tikal. Your guide will lead you along the pathways to the Templo del Gran Jaguar, where archeologists discovered stingray spines, pearls, and 180 jade artifacts buried in the tomb with the king. The structure stands over 144 feet tall with a small enclosure that is covered by a corbeled arch. You can marvel at Templo IV as it stands more than 213 feet tall, making it the second-largest pre-Columbian building discovered in the Western Hemisphere.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of fluffy Belizean biscuits will fill your dining room alongside the scent of freshly made jam. The marketplace in San Ignacio will fill with locals in search of perfect produce along aisles filled with local merchants. Vendors will showcase fresh empanadas and hand-carved artwork, such as etchings that reveal intricate Mayan symbols and Belizean cultural icons. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to the airfield for a short flight to Belize City, where you will board your transfer home.

tourName: Belize for All Ages: Family with Seniors Tour
placesVisited: San Ignacio, Ambergris Caye, Hol Chan Marine Reserve, Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, Xunantunich
generalInfo: Celebrate natural wonders and historic splendor during your luxurious 8-day family Belize tour. Create lasting memories with your family during fascinating excursions in search of jaguars, hiding in the rainforest underbrush, or finding black howler monkeys among trees. The charms of Belize will enchant and inspire your family, from its azure Caribbean waters to the emerald leaves of the tropical jungle and hidden Mayan cities.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Introduction to Belize
dayInfo.description: Your flight will land at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport, where your private transfer will meet your family and escort you deep into the remarkable jungle terrain to your luxurious eco-friendly accommodation. After settling in to the comforts of your accommodation, the remainder of the day will be yours to enjoy the secluded destination as a family by walking along the Medicine Trail or visiting the butterfly farm. At the butterfly farm, you can learn about the stunning Blue Morpho butterfly by watching the life cycle progress from a pale green egg the emergence of the iridescent blue wings from the cocoon.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Wildlife along the Macal River
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, you will meet your guide in your hotel’s lobby and be led through the wilderness of Belize. The peaceful water away from the borders of San Ignacio will brush against serene shores that support dozens of endangered species, such as the scarlet macaw, Morelet’s crocodile, and jaguars. Your family will feel inspired as you witness troops of these monkeys, which are the loudest terrestrial animal in the Western Hemisphere as their calls are audible for up to three miles away. The slow pace of your tour will provide you and your family with more time to view the wildlife.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: The marvels of the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary will welcome you with nearly 200 square miles of preserved jungle terrain. The lush and dense forest terrain supports flocks of neotropical birds in addition to wildcats, grazing tapir, and elegant deer, which represents the incredible biodiversity through a mosaic of rugged landscapes. A marked trail will lead you from the visitor’s center deeper into the jungle, where you will find the colorful beaks of keel-billed toucans as they forage for nuts. The sanctuary protects approximately 20 jaguars that live and hunt within the tree canopy.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – The Mayan Ruins of Xunantunich
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, you will meet your guide and travel to the fascinating site of Xunantunich, which is one of Belize’s most impressive archeological sites. Your family will delight in traveling across the waters of the Mopan River by a classic hand-cranked cable ferry, and the warmth of the tropical jungle will blanket the complex upon your arrival. Your guide will lead you among the deserted homes and preserved architecture that reflect the depths of the Mayan civilization. You can climb the steps to the top of the structure to earn the reward of a panoramic view of a classic Maya settlement and the eastern frieze.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris - Delight in a Zipline Tour
dayInfo.description: Today, your family will indulge in an exhilarating zipline excursion that will have you gliding through the trees. Your guide will escort you from your hotel to the base of your adventure in the rainforest, where you will travel up to 75 feet above the forest floor along a series of elevated platforms. During your ziplining adventure, you will be able to hear the chatter of the birds hidden in the trees. You can also visit the famous Actun Tunichil Muknal Cave before reaching Ambergris Caye. Here, you and your family will discover the surprising Crystal Maiden, which is a skeleton of a woman covered in calcium carbonate.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Hol Chan Marine Reserve
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will board a boat and venture to the heart of Hol Chan Marine Reserve, which covers 4,448 acres on a natural break in the reef. Here, you will plunge into the tropical waters with your guide for an incredible snorkeling tour within the marine gardens. During your expedition, you will discover the spectacular hues of the reef. The protected marine area offers refuge for sea anemones, curious moray eels, and sea turtles. You will continue with your family to Shark Ray Alley, where you will have a captivating time witnessing groups of nurse sharks and stingrays.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Family Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, the day will be at your leisure to indulge in the beauty of the island and greater Belize at your preferred pace. For an exciting possibility, you can indulge in a cruise around Swallow Caye Wildlife Sanctuary, where the protected land and water covers over 9,000 acres. Your skipper will turn off the motor, causing the boat to float quietly on the calming water surrounded by the emerald hue of the bordering jungle. On your way back to the dock near your hotel, you can also find bottlenose dolphins as they leap out of the Caribbean Sea.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can indulge in the majesty of Ambergris Caye before the streets of San Pedro brim with activity. When the shops and restaurants in town open, the air will fill with the aromas of traditional Belizean dishes, such as steaming tamales, stewed chicken, and the invigorating scent of fresh ceviche. At breakfast, you will find the exquisite flavors of mangos, grapefruits, and bananas before your transfer meets you in the lobby and escorts you to the Ambergris Caye airport for your flight to Belize City, where you will continue home.

tourName: Belize Trip for the Adventurous Couple
placesVisited: Mayflower Bocawina National Park, Glover’s Reef Marine Reserve, Half Moon Caye, Belize City
generalInfo: This 10-day Belize tour leads you off the beaten track as you stay on near-uninhabited islets. Find a private piece of paradise, kayak together on remote Caribbean reefs, and walk hand in hand across the white sand on this unique getaway for two. Your days can be spent kayaking, snorkeling, and laying on the beach, and your evenings can be just the two of you and the stars.

dayInfo.title: Mayflower Bocawina National Park – Arrival
dayInfo.description: Your Caribbean escape will begin in the rainforest. While that may sound peculiar, it would be a shame to miss out on the pristine nature that covers Belize’s coastline. When you land, you will transfer to the trees, where you will find monkeys as they watch over the trails. Jaguars live here, and although they are secretive and near impossible to see, they indicate just how untouched the wilderness is. The rainforest has escapist qualities that are similar to the islands, and you will quickly feel disconnected from the rest of the world.

dayInfo.title: Mayflower Bocawina National Park – Ziplining
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will indulge in a guided hike through the rainforest. From the ground, you can get a real sense of the rainforest’s intricacies. You can enjoy lunch back at your lodge before enjoying an alternative perspective. Ziplines cross this national park and will take you through the canopy. You will have a bird’s-eye view of the wilderness. Some of the ziplines will carry you above the trees with your feet dangling above the greenery. The first zipline can be frightening, but you will quickly get used to the system.

dayInfo.title: Glover’s Reef Marine Reserve – Adventures in Paradise
dayInfo.description: You can watch the colors change as you travel from rainforest to remote tropical reef. You will have traveled beyond the barrier reef to a remote islet where the sand is devoid of footprints. Upon your arrival, you will settle in to your accommodation and spend the afternoon with your local guide on a snorkeling and sea kayaking excursion. This escape will be focused on providing you with private space as a couple. After your introduction, you will be left to do what you want to do as a couple.

dayInfo.title: Glover’s Reef Marine Reserve – Create Your Adventure
dayInfo.description: These two days will be left free so that you can customize your adventure. You can paddle out to the inner and outer walls of Glover’s Reef or snorkel pristine areas of the Belize Barrier Reef. At low tide, you might find a slither of sand for the two of you, and at high tide, you can find solace in the sound of the surf. You can also stroll hand in hand around the caye, try stand-up paddleboarding, and learn how to kayak sail. There will be nothing to interrupt your tranquility and this private piece of paradise you have found.

dayInfo.title: Belize City – A Morning in the Caribbean
dayInfo.description: Every day will begin with idyllic options. You can go for a swim, sip on a coffee, paddle around the caye, or take your snorkel to a favorite place you have found. Stand-up paddleboarding is a great way to get your body moving in the morning. After a full morning on Southwest Caye, you will transfer to the mainland at Dangriga Airport, where you will fly to Belize City. After several days in intimate camp accommodation, you will now stay in contemporary luxury. It will be a change of pace before you travel back to a different stretch of the Belize Barrier Reef. The day will be at your leisure, and there is plenty to see when you stroll the streets around your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Half Moon Caye – Journeys on the Water
dayInfo.description: Half Moon Caye will be the second of your Caribbean destinations, and getting there will be part of your adventure. You will travel by speedboat through the lagoons of Turneffe Atoll and then across the Caribbean Sea. Half Moon Caye is found on the edge of the Northern Hemisphere’s most extended reef system. You will arrive at the island and orientate yourself with your new sandy surroundings. There are places to swim, shaded palms to rest beneath, and all the water sports equipment to create a grand couple’s adventure. In the evening, you will find yourself alone beneath the stars.

dayInfo.title: Half Moon Caye – A Remote Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: There is nothing definitive about your daily program. You can swing in a two-person hammock through the heat of the day or spend the day sea kayaking. Over these two days, you will have the option of going on a snorkeling excursion to the Great Blue Hole and a Caribbean sinkhole of breathtaking color. This is just an option, but you will see more people in the water here than the rest of the week combined. Just like when staying at Glover’s Reef, all your meals will be included. White sand will be at your feet, the coral will surround you, and a tropical panorama will travel with you wherever you go.

dayInfo.title: Half Moon Caye – Departure
dayInfo.description: Your speedboat transfer will be timed to meet your international flight, which means that you can enjoy a relaxing final morning on Half Moon Caye. It is two hours by boat to Belize City. From there, you will have a short transfer to the airport, where you will connect with your outbound flight.

tourName: Best of Belize for Seniors Tour
placesVisited: Lamanai, Ambergris
generalInfo: Tranquil beauty, an enchanting heritage, and a captivating culture will immerse you in the best of Belize on a custom-tailored 8-day seniors tour. Golden sands and sparkling waters provide endless opportunities for active exploration, while pathways that wind through the dense canopy can reveal treasures like Mayan ruins and sleeping jaguars. Meet with naturalist guides, search for sea turtles, and embrace the diversity of the land and sea for an exclusive tour of Belize that is customized just for you.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – Sunset Cruise near Your Jungle Lodge
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will greet you upon your arrival at Philip S. W. Goldson International Airport in Belize City and transfer you to your luxurious lodge in the tropical wilderness at Lamanai. After settling in to the comforts of your luxury accommodation, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to indulge in the fascinating setting, immersing you in the heart of the tropics. You will board a sunset cruise on the New River Lagoon, where you will be able to see the surrounding density tropical jungle. The 30-foot pontoon boat will provide a smooth ride with views of crocodiles that lounge in the water near the shoreline.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – Archeological Tour of Mayan Treasures
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will meet you at the lodge and escort you to one of the most picturesque Mayan ruins in the country. Where you are traveling today, three large pyramids tower over the open plaza and are surrounded by dense, tropical jungle. You will travel by boat through some of the most fascinating jungle terrain that lines the river while listening for howler monkeys and the chirps of a variety of bird species that can be found in the area. Upon your arrival, your guide will lead you on a tour of the ruins before providing you with some to explore at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – Wilderness Experience and Sunset Expedition
dayInfo.description: Before sunrise, you will meet your naturalist guide at your lodge and venture into the wilderness for insight into lively terrain. You will continue your search for the majestic wilderness of the Belize jungle, scouring the landscape for signs of toucans or the impressive jaguar. Your expedition into the wilderness of Belize will continue in the afternoon as you board a canoe bound for a local tributary. As you traverse the waterway, you will likely encounter manatees that curiously check on your canoe.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – Jungle Avifauna and Crocodiles
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will meet your naturalist guide at your lodge and set out on an exceptional excursion in search of the nearly 400 documented bird species that can be found within a three-mile radius of your accommodation. White ibis peck their beaks into the soft soils of the marsh, and Northern Jacanas hop along the lily pads in search of water bugs. Your adventure into the wilderness of Belize will continue as you travel by airboat with a naturalist guide across the floodplains, where you can watch as your guide attempts to capture an endangered Morelet’s crocodile to mark and collect data in the hopes of preserving the species.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Indulge in a Culinary Tour
dayInfo.description: The scent of the jungle will fade from your mind as your private transfer escorts you from your lodge to a local airfield, where you will board a flight bound for the incredible island of Ambergris Caye. You will glide at a low altitude for the brief journey, which may be reminiscent of a scenic excursion, offering gorgeous views of the impressively clear Caribbean waters. Ambergris Caye will offer you an impressive balance of narrow lanes and the beauty of a tropical paradise. After settling in to the comforts of your coastal accommodation, you will have a private culinary tour of the island, which will introduce you to the indelible local flavors of Belizean cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Marine Marvels of Ambergris Caye
dayInfo.description: The grandeur of the Caribbean Sea will become your playground today as you embark on a private snorkeling tour that will lead you within the more than six square miles of protected reef inside the Hol Chan Marine Reserve. Your magnificent vision of Ambergris Caye’s marine life will continue at Shark Ray Alley, where local fishermen clean their fish and gear, attracting nurse sharks and stingrays. You can plunge into the water once more and watch as crowds of nurse sharks and stingrays flock to the area. The exhilarating experience will also allow you to watch the spectacle from within the boat instead of the water if this makes you feel more comfortable.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – The Splendors of Ambergris
dayInfo.description: The day will be yours to enjoy the charms of Ambergris Caye at your preferred pace, from lounging on the golden sand to basking on a secluded sandbar at sunset. For a marvelous excursion across the island, you can indulge in a bike ride, which will lead you from the casual seaside pathways to the inland streets, where pedestrians and golf carts roam. The Mayan archeological site of Marco Gonzalez is located on the south edge of the island with 49 distinctive structures and a main plaza that dates back approximately 2,100 years.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the dining room of your accommodations will fill with the aromas of fried flour dough, honey, fresh jams, and tropical fruits, such as pineapple and soursop. The luscious fragrance of cacao derives from the Belize Chocolate Company, which produces the finest chocolate on the island and is layered with the familiar and comforting aroma of the briny breeze. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your flight to Belize City to make your connection home, bringing an end to your tour of Belize.

tourName: Best of Belize & Guatemala Vacation Tour in Seven Days
placesVisited: San Ignacio, Â Tikal, Antigua, Lake Atitlan
generalInfo: This customized vacation tour shows you the best of Belize and Guatemala in seven days. You will discover that the Mayan civilization did not disappear but rather scattered across the panorama, taking you from the beaches of Belize to the highlands of Guatemala, following in the footsteps of a heritage that stirred mystique, archeological brilliance, and artistic imagination. Mayan history is alluring, and the culture remains strong along the landscape of Central America. The jungle opens up to stone temples towering above the canopy; men and women wear striking garments decorated with captivating colors. Ornaments decorate hidden caves where narrow rivers once guided shamans.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Arrive at your Lush Jungle Lodge
dayInfo.description: Your flight descends into Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport in Belize City. Look out the window and see where the Caribbean Sea touches the jungle. Board your connecting flight, and continue deep into Belize’s west, an area of the country lush with tropical trees and vivacious wildlife. Your plane lands at San Ignacio Airport, a small municipality named for its proximity to San Ignacio. The city is home to Belize’s only suspension bridge, connecting the town village of Santa Elena located on the eastern bank of the Macal River. A small museum next to the Town Hall exhibits images of the region’s history and vibrant culture, along with providing a space for artists to display their work and musicians to play long into the night. Your private transfer awaits your arrival at the airport and escorts you along the pebble-paved road to your secluded and luxurious jungle lodge. The concierge will greet you in the lobby and offer cold juice made from berries picked from the hotel’s organic farm. Press a cool peppermint towel to your neck and face and the aroma, along with the temperature, is refreshing. The trickling sound of the infinity pool blends with the movement of the nearby river.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Explore the Waters and Caves at Nohoch Chen Archaeological Park
dayInfo.description: The Nature Reserve around the property encompasses 356 acres of land where more than 300 birds nest year round. In the morning, the blue-crowned motmot fills the trees with a calm hoot. Stand on your private deck and see one tucked into the treetops. The blue shades along their tail stand out from the emerald leaves; the ends of their tail feathers dangle below the branches like tassels. After breakfast, your guide will meet you at the lobby and escort you to Nohoch Chen Archaeological Park, which locals refer to as Caves Branch. The river shines emerald green and winds beneath the open mouths of different limestone caves. Jump into the cove water and board an inner tube to follow the intricate watery maze beneath the rocks. The caves open up into cathedral-like spaces, and you can hear the water rushing along the rocky walls. The sound echoes as you travel along the river network of more than four miles, encompassing five separate caves. The Mayan believed that the caves were an entrance into the underworld, linking the human realm with the spirit world. Stalactites dangle from the ceiling and vines move in the gentle cross breeze as you follow in the footsteps of the Mayan and gain a bit of understanding into their beliefs, noticing archways and formation where ancient rituals once took place.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Full Day Snorkel Tour along the Great Belize Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: In the morning, search the trees for interesting avifauna, listening for distinct calls and the vibrant plumage standing out against the canopy. Emerald toucanets perch on thin branches, their precious plumage blends into the leaves but their large bill radiates yellow and black. Their tail feathers shine a rusty red. After breakfast, make your way along the Hummingbird Highway, a scenic drive through the Maya Mountains. The aroma of citrus emanates from the orange and lime groves. Your driver points out the banana trees growing alongside the highway. A specific mountaintop resembles a large face, earning it the name “The Sleeping Giant.” Arrive at the traditional Garifuna town of Dangriga, located at the mouth of the North Stann Creek River. The culture of the city stems from shipwrecked slaves and natives of the Caribbean. Step onto a boat at the marina and venture out onto the water to explore a sample of the 170-mile living coral reef, the second largest reef in the world. The ecosystem includes 70 different types of hard coral and more than 500 species of fish. The water is cool on your skin and crystal clear as the sunlight spreads across the seafloor, illuminating the niches and hidden aquatic life along South Water Caye. Spotlight parrotfish glow with red, green, and yellow hues. Their clear water accentuates the parrotfish’s colors, which can grow longer than one foot and contains the same sense of drama as the pink and orange coral rising from the sand.

dayInfo.title: Tikal – Transfer to Tikal in Guatemala and Discover the Mayan Ruins
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, the aroma of roasted coffee drifts beneath the thatched roof of the open restaurant as you hear the birds calling out in the cool morning air. The scent of fresh flour tortillas blends with the aroma of papaya. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to Guatemalan border. Your escort meets you on the opposite side to continue your journey to the coveted grounds of Tikal, taking you deeper into the jungle. Goats and cows graze on the undulating hills encircling small towns as you pass sporadic waterways sparkling in the sunlight. You stop at the entrance gate Tikal. Signs tell visitors to watch out for snakes, jaguars, and wild turkeys as the guard checks your ticket into the park. Suddenly, you realize that you are standing in an area holding ten square miles of Mayan ruins. The limestone jungle allowed the trees and brush to swallow the abandoned former massive city due to its fast- growing vegetation. Your guide points out a tarantula clinging to a tree as a group of coati, animals similar to raccoons, roam through the lush grass in search of food. Sporadic steles rise out of the ground, edging thick stone staircases. The scale of the city comes clear in the Great Plaza, where Temples I and II face each other from across the square. Temple I, known as the Great Jaguar Temple, was erected in the 8th century AD and stands 154 feet tall. A large collection of human and animal bones, along with jade and shell ornaments, was discovered inside the tomb in the 1960s. The steep incline draws attention to the three-roomed structure, and the roof comb crowning the edifice. You have seen the iconic large central stairway leading to the pyramid plateau in photos, but the photos do not do the pyramids’ grandeur justice.

dayInfo.title: Antigua – Fly from Flores to Guatemala City and Settle in Colonial Antigua
dayInfo.description: Your connecting flight takes you from Flores to Guatemala City, the capital of Guatemala, where your private transfer awaits your arrival. Descending into Guatemala City is an experience in and of itself. High-rises tower above the urban sprawl, attempting to reach the heights of the surrounding volcano peaks. Meet your private transfer at baggage claim and make your way to the colonial city of Antigua. The city acted as the capital of Guatemala until the 18th century after an earthquake devastated the community. Pastel facades line the cobblestone streets as men pull carts along the avenues selling different types of nuts. Church spires tower above the understated, tile-roofed structures. Three volcanic peaks enclose the cityscape. A large cross crowns Cerro de la Cruz, devoted to Antigua’s patron saint. Immediately fall into the city’s charms, from the brimming plazas to the bustling markets. The aroma of fresh, decadent coffee drifts out of the favored cafes; indulgent chocolate displays fill the Chocolate Museum. Demonstrations provide visitors with tricks and techniques on how to utilize the various flavors of the chocolate in numerous dishes. Visit the Santo Domingo del Cerro Cultural Park for an exclusive look at the contemporary highland culture of Guatemala. The park contains sculpture galleries and murals dedicated to the works of Efrain Recinos, the Picasso of Guatemala. Recinos designed whimsical pieces that told stories of Guatemala’s history and blended heritage with the contemporary world. Each mural depicts a different form of communication, a recurring theme for the late artist.

dayInfo.title: Lake Atitlan – Relish the Scenic Drive and Tranquil Region of Lake Atitlan
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you along the switchback roads into the mountains to reach the main lakeside port town of Panajachel. Art stores and craft tables line the main road leading to the water. Stunning paintings depicting daily life along the highlands and traditional wood-carven images provide artistic insight into the heritage of the region, and the continued vibrant aesthetic. Small villages speckle the hillsides leading to the water’s edge, reachable only by boat. Wildflowers bloom against the thriving emerald canopy. The aroma of fresh tortillas drifts as a woman shapes the flour before placing it on the heated stone. Board your boat, and travel to the shores of Santa Cruz, a vertical town climbing the hillside. Your accommodation is located at the edge of the river. The wake is mild, and the wind blows through your hair, at times carrying mist from the freshwater. Your hotel overlooks the lake with its pier jutting out from the shore. The small balcony and tranquil common area is filled with hammocks and cushioned seats, providing a perfect view of the lake. Your room is located above the trees, offering an unforgettable panorama of the blossoming wildflowers, towering peaks, and cobalt water. Take a tuk-tuk to the top of the vertical town of Santa Cruz to find the traditional Mayan culture. At Cave Sabor Cruceno, meet your instructor to learn how to produce tantalizing Guatemalan fusion cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Antigua – Visit the Villages around the Lake to see Mayan Culture
dayInfo.description: The treasures of the lake brim from the local villages and emanate from the absorbing natural beauty. For breakfast, sit on the balcony of the restaurant and listen to the water lap against the wooden posts beneath you as little blue heron graze on the soft edges of the water. After your meal, venture out to explore the spectacular waters and its borders. In the village of Santiago, find the Cojolya Association of Maya Women Weavers. A small museum exhibits the history and artistry of backstrap loom weaving. Demonstrations provide insight into the full process of weaving, from spinning the cotton fibers to producing a finished textile. A local artisan, using traditional weaving and dying methods and native to Santiago, made each product on display in the shop. The association helps pass down the traditions of weaving from generation to generation, along with ensuring a safe and friendly working environment for women and girls in the region. Friars erected the Colegio de San Jeronimo in the 18th century. The king of Spain took over the edifice and decreed it a Royal Customs House. Today, the site acts as an open-air museum; an octagonal fountain stands at the heart of the cloister. Occasional cultural performances enhance the beauty of the structure and showcase its connection to the greater city. The country is filled with incredible culture and a deep connection to its heritage, whether Pre-Columbian or Spanish. Outside of Lago Atitlan, the remnants of Kaqchikel’s 15th-century capital stand in a serene park-like setting in an area known as Iximché. Pilgrims from around Guatemala come to pay homage to the ceremonial site where more than 160 structures have been uncovered and mapped. The Great Palace I was a residential complex with three separate phases of construction. The first edifice covered 5,400 square feet and formed the core of the palace with four long single rooms encircling a courtyard. After your exploration of Atitlan and its surroundings you return to Antigua for the evening. When you are ready, your private transfer escorts you from Antigua to La Aurora International Airport in Guatemala City for your flight home.

tourName: Central America Family Odyssey
placesVisited: Guatemala City, Antigua, Flores, Tikal, San Ignacio, Xunantunich, Actun Tunichil Muknal, Placencia, San Jose, Arenal
generalInfo: From colonial Antigua to the Caribbean Sea, Maya cities to volcanic valleys, and Pacific beaches, this 3-week odyssey celebrates all the magic of Central America. Handcrafted for your family, this itinerary is filled with destinations and activities to excite every age along with seven quiet beach days. Imagine wildlife safari, volcano walks, mysterious ruins, cobbled plazas, river journeys, and superb accommodation all with your family in mind. Three countries in three weeks will be an adventure your family will never forget as you take in the best of Central America.

dayInfo.title: Antigua – A Horse and Carriage Along the Cobbles
dayInfo.description: Land in Guatemala and a horse-drawn carriage ride through Antigua will provide an evocative first impression. The carriage is from a forgotten era and the only wheels that ply Antigua’s old center, perfect for your family to roll past the sights while still enjoying privacy. The arrival will feel especially good if you have any apprehension about what to expect in Central America, as you can just sit back in the carriage and take in the impressions from a private vantage point. Earlier today you will land in Guatemala City and be greeted by your guide at the arrivals gate. It will be a one-hour transfer to Antigua, to check-in at your boutique hotel within the pedestrianized area, and then get your bearings with a private horse-drawn carriage tour.

dayInfo.title: Antigua – The Perfect Introduction to Guatemala
dayInfo.description: Terracotta tiles slope towards the cobbled streets in the heart of Antigua, preserved since the city was a central piece of Spain’s empire. Houses are painted imaginative hues, each a contrasting color that livens the streets. Palaces and churches bring grandeur, with all kinds of flourishes to impress art lovers. Your guide will bring the stories with tales of the takeover, rebellion, and perhaps a few gory details to keep the children interested. You will be led on a half-day private Antigua walking tour for a chance to soak up all the sights and history. The afternoon will be at your leisure, and there are various options in the vicinity, or you could happily relax on cafe terraces close to the hotel.

dayInfo.title: Flores – Culture and Adventure on Lake Peten Itza
dayInfo.description: There is now a direct flight across Guatemala to Flores, so travel time is minimal as you swap the city for Lake Peten Itza. Check into your jungle hideaway on the water, and then customize the afternoon to your family’s interests. Mountain biking and kayaking are included, and the resident guide will give you a detailed map showing trails to follow. There is some superb jungle hiking, and you can be accompanied by a guide who knows where to find howler monkeys and rare birds. Take a trip on the lake by motorboat or try one of the canopy tours that are on offer nearby as with a base on Lake Peten Itza, it will be easy to enjoy everything Flores has to offer.

dayInfo.title: Flores – The Mystery of the Mayas at Tikal
dayInfo.description: Howler monkeys guard the trails into Tikal, hooting loudly as if guardians of a forgotten time. Parakeets tweet, and then flutter their wings as you walk deeper into the jungle. A temple rises out of nowhere as moss clings to stone steps and inscriptions are still evident on the facade. This is the lost Maya city, a place of mystery that makes you feel like an adventurer regardless of your age. A guide takes you through the city on a private walking tour, explaining pyramid structures and stelae, sharing redolent tales of the Mayas and their civilization. Take a packed lunch to enjoy in the jungle city then return to the lakeside around mid-afternoon, whether the children may want to live out their own Maya mystery.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – First Impressions of Belize
dayInfo.description: Cross the border but stay in the rainforest as you enjoy your first impressions of Belize. The language changes and the roadside scenes seem a little different, although howler and spider monkeys show how to roam across borders without passports. You will be spending several days in Western Belize, a land of pristine wilderness that is alive with the sound of wildlife. Monkeys roam, iguanas fill the treetops, and there is always a profusion of life along the river.
