dayInfo.title: Cayo – Coffee and Maya History
dayInfo.description: Today, you will hop across the border to Guatemala, and you will not even have to leave the rainforest. Your destination for the day will be the ruins of Tikal. Coffee plantations cover the hills, and you will stop for a quick tour to trace liquid’s journey from bean to cup. Soon the ruins of Tikal will emerge with pyramid structures that surge from the forest floor. As you descend and walk through the rainforest, it will seem like the city has disappeared. Suddenly, another temple will appear, standing in a redolent state of ruin. This is a Lost City within a nature reserve. You will spend the whole afternoon exploring with your local guide.

dayInfo.title: Cayo – Ruins in the Jungle
dayInfo.description: Today will be flexible, and you will have a private guide to customize your adventure. Cayo has its own Maya ruins, but Xunantunich is the most impressive. You can venture here on an afternoon trip. Sunrise and sunset are the best times to visit because you can ascend the main temple and admire the colors as they change across the rainforest. Another option for the day will be to go cave-tubing. You can also zipline through the jungle, canoe downriver through a rainforest cave, or spend some time hiking to waterfalls in Mountain Pine Ridge.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – White-Sand Charm
dayInfo.description: Landing on Ambergris Caye will provide you with a unique memory . Your boutique lodge will have its own piece of the coastline, and your balcony will look out over the water. Now will be the time to take off your shoes and leave your watch on the bedside table. In many ways, this is the archetypal Caribbean getaway. Several days will provide lazy hours underneath the sun. You can opt to take a kayak out to a coral reef or spend the afternoon in San Pedro, which is an energetic town of beach bars and colorfully-painted houses. You will touch down in the morning and have the rest of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Scenic Flight and Island Escape
dayInfo.description: The Great Blue Hole is Belize’s most iconic sight. As the name suggests, this Caribbean sinkhole is as great as it is blue. One way to explore is to dive into the abyss, but this is only for experienced scuba divers. A more accessible and more beautiful experience can come in the form of a scenic flight. On a one-hour flight, you can enjoy an uninterrupted view over both the Great Blue Hole and Belize Barrier Reef. Your pilot will also loop around so that everyone in the small plane gets the full panoramic view. This flight is best taken in the morning because it leaves an entire afternoon to relax on the beach.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Catamaran Tour
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will sail away on a catamaran. Cruising away from Ambergris Caye, you will head past the uninhabited islets and coral gardens for a new perspective of the landscape. In the marine reserve, you can jump from the boat for a guided snorkel with the nurse and the reef sharks. It is a very safe experience, and you will be accompanied by your guide the entire time. Flotation devices will also be available. Your catamaran tour will continue to a deserted islet. Here, palm trees will provide shade while you rest through the midday heat. You will have a second snorkeling stop on the way back to Ambergris Caye before a final evening on the sea.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today, you will fly back to Belize City and transfer to the international airport, where you will connect your homebound flight.

tourName: One-Week Scuba Diving Belize Vacation
placesVisited: Turneffe Atoll
generalInfo: Explore Belize’s Barrier Reef and all its seduction and surprise with this one-week scuba diving excursion. Biodiversity dominates the Northern Hemisphere’s longest reef chain to provide incredible scuba diving. Descend the Great Blue Hole, surround yourself with spawning groupers, follow schools of fish, and go in search of the animals that are unique to Belize. Spend nearly a week on a private island in Turneffe Atoll with 15 dives.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – First Impressions
dayInfo.description: You will land in Belize City, which is on the coast. Your driver will greet and transfer you to the harbor, and it will be a 90-minute speedboat journey to Turneffe Atoll. Turneffe Island is in the heart of Belize’s Barrier Reef. This location is best understood during the last few moments of your speedboat transfer because there is an abundance of life beneath the water. This is coral for exploring with a snorkel, which is something you can do after checking in to the island’s only resort. A snorkel will also give you an indication of the conditions, particularly the warmth of the water and the lack of currents.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – Introductory Boat Dives
dayInfo.description: Today you will kick off a week of scuba diving. As with most long diving vacations, this first day will concentrate on your skills and the local conditions. Unless you are already a divemaster or have dived in the last six months, your day will begin with a refresher dive. The conditions are almost always calm, and there are no challenging currents to negotiate. 30 meters of visibility is the norm here, and many dive sites offer closer to 40 meters. This is ideal for wildlife sightings and presents an opportunity for your divemaster to follow unusual species. As the week continues, you will soon discover why Turneffe is the most spectacular and biodiverse of Belize’s atolls.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – More Turneffe Dive Sites
dayInfo.description: After yesterday’s introductory dives, you will begin the day at Turneffe’s best-known site of The Elbow. This is a place where big fish spawn and different species congregate during different months of the year. This abundance of new life attracts even bigger hunters, particularly sharks. This will be a dive that is designed to follow the action. The dive schedule for this week will not be set in stone. With a 15-dive package, you will pick and choose from more than 30 different dive sites, and your divemasters will have the final say based on local conditions. There are so many sites to choose from, so if there is a strong surge from the west, you can easily switch to the eastern side of the atoll.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – Great Blue Hole and Lighthouse Reef
dayInfo.description: Lighthouse Atoll can provide a great break from days of diving Turneffe. You will experience Belize’s iconic attraction and one of the bucket-list dive sites that Jacques Cousteau helped present to the world. The Great Blue Hole is a surreal gap in the earth’s crust where the water is an eerie hue. Marine life is limited here, and many divers emerge disappointed because they expect a reef-style experience. After two days of reef diving there, you will really appreciate the Great Blue Hole as a subterranean world of caverns, stalactites, and stalagmites. You can take a boat to Lighthouse Reef in the morning and dive the Great Blue Hole.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – Customizing Your Adventure
dayInfo.description: By now, you will be settled into the island rhythm. Each day you will visit a different part of the atoll to discover the reef chain. During your dives, you will see a wide variety of marine life, such as toadfish, sea turtles, dolphins, manatees, reef sharks, eagle rays, whale sharks, pilot whales, killer whales, and hawksbill turtles. With one dive, you can only see so much, but with a week, you will see more than you could have ever imagined. You will venture to Blackbird Caye for high-quality wall diving. As mentioned before, your dive schedule will be flexible, so you can adjust the final itinerary to your interests and desires. All meals will be included, and your accommodation is designed to maximize space and privacy.

dayInfo.title: Turneffe Atoll – Departure
dayInfo.description: Depending on your flight time, you may have the opportunity for a final dive this morning. You will travel back to the mainland by speedboat. Late check-out can be arranged, and there is always a final memory to take away from the island, such as the feeling of soft wet sand between the toes as you sip on a freshly husked coconut. You will transfer to Belize City to connect with your international flight.

tourName: Romantic Belize Vacation for Senior Couples
placesVisited: Ambergris, San Ignacio, Placencia
generalInfo: This thrilling 12-day adventure offers an active exploration with specialist guides, private transfers, and activities that can be tailored to your preferred pace. Let the beauty of tropical islands and pristine rainforest seduce you during this custom-tailored, senior Belize tour for couples, which will immerse you in the majesty of preserved culture with the endless allure of luxurious accommodations. Bask in the grandeur of the Caribbean Sea and discover untold Mayan treasures beneath the sounds of active wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – A Relaxing First Day
dayInfo.description: The impressive and majestic ambiance of Ambergris Caye will delight you upon your arrival at the local airport, where your private transfer will greet you and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city. After settling into the comforts of your luxury accommodation, the remainder of the day will be at your leisure to acquaint yourself with the beauty of Ambergris Caye and the charms of the town of San Pedro. As you walk through the town, you will notice pastel facades and a refreshing breeze, leading you to a local art gallery that specializes in Belizean ethnic crafts.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Marine Marvels
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will meet you at the dock connected to your accommodation and whisk you along the Caribbean to Belize’s oldest marine reserve, which covers over 4,448 acres. You will follow your guide into the warm water to find shimmering coral and fascinating marine life in the world’s second-largest barrier reef. The kingdom of coral offers a romantic perspective by which to view the natural beauty of Belize with visibility in the water averaging 65 feet. Your adventure in the water will continue at Shark Ray Alley, where you can watch large groups of nurse sharks and stingrays swarm your boat in search of chum.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Manatee-Spotting Tour
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will meet your guide in the hotel lobby and venture back to the water along a series of secluded cayes. The peaceful boat ride will offer you glimpses of aquamarine waters that lap at the white sand shoreline, resembling an exotic paradisiacal escape. Manatees often linger near the Swallow Caye Wildlife Sanctuary, which covers nearly 9,000 acres of the ocean floor. Your guide will point out a pair of West Indian manatees that call the reserve home. They can grow up to 11.5 feet long and weigh over 1,320 pounds.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris – Orange Walk District and Lamanai Ruins
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer to Orange Walk for a day of exploring the district best-known for the sweet scent of sugarcane. You will board a boat and cast off onto the New River to reach the Maya destination of Lamanai. With over 800 structures buried amid the underbrush and covered by the dense canopy, Lamanai is laden with the sounds of howler monkeys. Your guide will point to the shimmering petals of blooming orchids that thrive in the jungle ambiance before you dock and venture into the rainforest plateau.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Exciting Zipline Excursion
dayInfo.description: This morning, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and transfer you to San Pedro Airport for your brief air transfer to the striking jungle terrain of San Ignacio. You will reach your destination deep within the jungle canopy for a marvelous ride through the trees that will offer you a unique perspective of Belize’s wilderness and wildlife during a ziplining excursion. The majesty of the woodlands highlights the fabulous biodiversity of the rainforest across ten platforms. You will feel the wind brush against your cheeks as you soar up to 250 feet while hearing the gentle hoot of the Lesson’s Motmot or the echoing tap of the pale-billed woodpecker.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Barton Creek and Mountain Pine Ridge Reserve
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide will greet you in your hotel lobby and lead you to the edge of Barton Creek Cave, which is the largest river cave in the city. The early hours possess a gentle mist that sprawls across the glassy water with the surface of the river reflecting the cave’s luscious foliage. You will glide along the stoic water and venture into the depths of the cavern. You will continue to Mountain Pine Ridge Reserve, where the spiced scent of pine drifts upward from the protected forest. Your guide will then lead you along a manicured trail to reach a panoramic view of Thousand Foot Falls.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – The Beauty of Cahal Pech
dayInfo.description: Today, your guide will collect you at your hotel and lead you to the shade that surrounds the Cahal Pech, which is the oldest-known Maya site found in the Belize River valley. You can walk beneath the famous Maya corbel arch and view the main step temple from inside the courtyard. Your guide will also lead you through the forested trails to find the Temazcal, which is an ancient sauna that was once used for health and religious purposes. You will continue your exploration of Belize’s outdoors and connection to important wildlife with a visit to the Green Iguana Conservation Project that focuses on the ecological importance of the river habitat with the preservation of green iguanas.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Actun Tunichil Muknal Cave
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture to The Actun Tunichil Muknal cave, which has a towering ceiling at 164 feet, resembling an elegant cathedral. Here, 14 known Mayans were sacrificed between the 8th and 10th centuries AD. Droplets will stream down the stalactites and drip into the waiting pool. Vessels, stone artifacts, and pieces of skeleton make up only a fraction of the incredible array of artifacts that have been discovered in the cave. Upon returning to the comforts of your luxurious accommodation, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to further explore the splendor of Belize.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Traverse Monkey River
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture to the shores of Monkey River before settling into the comforts of your luxury hotel on the Placencia Peninsula. Your boat will travel quietly along the water, passing the tropical beauty that lines the banks. The boat will dock at a secluded bank, where you can step onto a trail in search of black howler monkeys. When they holler, you can hear their echoing call from nearly three miles away. When your tour concludes, your guide will lead you back to Placencia to check in to your fabulous accommodations.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: You will have a full day to explore the natural wonders of the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, where the aromas of pine and scrub trees accentuate the clacking sound of toucans. Your guide will lead you on a select portion of the protected area’s more than 123,552 acres, which accounts for over 150 square miles of tropical forest. The wildlife sanctuary is also home to a sizable portion of Belize’s jaguar population, which will provide you with the opportunity to witness one of the endangered cats hiding in the trees. You can uncover scrap marks, paw prints, or a possible sighting as you explore the forest.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Snorkel in Gladden Spit
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, your guide will lead you along the water to reach the famous snorkeling destination of Gladden Spit, which is situated within the designated marine reserve. The stunning biodiversity hosts enormous schools of fish and attracts the elusive whale shark between March and June. The remarkable experience will submerge you in the warm water of the Caribbean with fantastic visibility, possibly providing you with excellent views of the massive whale shark. The whale shark visits Placencia each year in search of the clouds of fish eggs released during the mating season.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: This morning, fishermen will set out in their boats bound for the open sea. At breakfast, you can enjoy the aromas of the briny breeze as it sweeps inward from the Caribbean. The sunlight will reflect against the golden sand of Maya and Seine beach, while fragrant tropical fruits, such as guava and mango, fill your dining room with the sweet aroma of breakfast. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby to escort you to the Placencia Airport for a brief flight to Philip. S.W. Goldson International Airport in Belize City, where you will transfer to your outbound flight for home.

tourName: Ruins, Reefs and Rainforest: An Essential Belize Vacation
placesVisited: Mountain Pine Ridge, Caracol, Tikal, Chan Chich, Ambergris Caye
generalInfo: A trilogy of breathtaking landscapes come during this 11-day tour of Belize. Epic Maya ruins rise out of a jaguar populated rainforest, Caribbean islets stand above vibrant coral reefs, and the wilderness captures all of your senses. With over a week amid the rainforest, this luxury vacation celebrates Belize’s allure. All of the adventures are tailored to your energy levels, and the lodges will immerse you in every landscape for an incredible experience.

dayInfo.title: Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve – Arrival
dayInfo.description: You will be met at the international airport in Belize City, and you will have the option to take a short tour of the capital or transfer directly to the jungles of Western Belize. This is a country with three major roads, and Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve is far from all of them. Jaguars prowl the trees, ocelots and tapirs are regularly seen around sunset, and the bird list includes red-lored parrots and king vultures. Deep in this forest of misty pine is Francis Ford Coppola’s exclusive residence. Transformed into a 20-room hideaway, the lodge is surrounded by the sights, sounds, and smells of the wild. You will be staying here for the next few days.

dayInfo.title: Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve – Outdoor Adventure
dayInfo.description: You will be immersed in a landscape that encourages adventure, but the exact style of adventure is up to you. You can indulge in a sunrise horse ride through the pine, a hike in search of jaguars and cougars, or a walk that will allow you to track the wild cats in their natural environment. You can also glide through Barton Creek Cave in a canoe and take a stroll through the forest to spectacular waterfalls and viewpoints. Mountain Pine Ridge is a place of strange smells and sounds that will accompany you all day and into the night.

dayInfo.title: Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve – Ruins at Caracol
dayInfo.description: The Caracol ruins are so remote that you must take a government escort to reach them. On most days, there are not more than a handful of visitors. Standing on an excavated platform between the trees, Caracol is what remains of one of the Mayan’s most important cities. People lived here more than 3,000 years ago, although it has all been abandoned for millennia now. Here, you can ascend the temple steps, admire the carved altars, inspect the detail on the stelae, and walk across the plaza. This is a ghost city that you can spend an entire day exploring. Having a good guide will be essential and will help you understand the history of the city and civilization.

dayInfo.title: Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve – Guatemala and Tikal
dayInfo.description: Tikal is not just another Maya ruin. Yesterday at Caracol, you felt the scale of the ancient civilization, but today, you will uncover exceptional details. You will take a trip across the border to a Guatemalan coffee farm. Here, you will follow the process from bean to cup. Then, you will venture into the rainforest, where monkeys stand guard to the walking trails. Temples and pyramids rise dramatically from the forest floor, surging past the canopy with moss-covered steps and cracked stones. Many of the ruins have been overtaken by the jungle, but your guide will help you with all of the intricate details that have been preserved. You will return to Belize in the afternoon for another quiet evening in the forest.

dayInfo.title: Chan Chich – Jungle Lodge and Jaguar Prints
dayInfo.description: After two days of Mayan cities and a flight to Chan Chich, you will stay at a lodge that is built on an ancient Mayan plaza. Nestled inside a vast nature reserve, the lodge is a real getaway from the modern world. Monkeys shout, cat prints fill the forest, and small Maya ruins stand guard. Upon your arrival, you can spend the day creating your own adventure. The exotic wildlife is the main highlight, and although it is rare to see a jaguar, your guides will be experts at finding the cats. Your time here will be as if you are living out Mayan history with Western comforts.

dayInfo.title: Chan Chich – Actun Tunichil Muknal Caves
dayInfo.description: Actun Tunichil Muknal epitomizes the allure of Chan Chich. You will begin the day with a sunrise jungle hike, which is also the best time to search for the local wildlife. You will return to the lodge for a second breakfast before heading to another eerie jungle world, Actun Tunichil Muknal caves. To get here, you will cross rivers and climb over boulders into a realm that was only recently discovered. The subterranean journey will continue by boat, and you can pick up skulls and pots from an unknown time. This was a sacrificial Maya site. You can spend up to three to four hours in the cave system. When you return to your lodge, you can spend the rest of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Caribbean Island Luxury
dayInfo.description: From the rainforest to the reef and from ruins to the beach, your vacation will end with four self-guided days on Ambergris Caye. Belize’s largest island is the typical Caribbean getaway that is free of crowds and the large-scale resorts that have changed so many other Caribbean islands. Although this is Belize’s largest island, Ambergris Caye is barely a mile long. You will fly here from Belize City and then transfer via water taxi to a remote part of the island. With a villa on the sand, there will not be much to think about here. You can kick off your shoes and stop thinking about the time.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – The Bounty of the Barrier Reef
dayInfo.description: Here, mornings are cool and quiet, the afternoons are usually warmer, and the evenings are sultry with everything from cocktails at beach bars to lazy hours of gazing at the stars. Nothing will be planned for these three days, although there are many different options that you can choose from based on your interests. You can indulge in snorkeling, scuba diving, and a scenic flight over the area. Catamaran tours can last two hours at sunset or a full day and may include stops to snorkel and to indulge in a seafood barbecue on a deserted island. After all the adventure in the jungle, you will now be immersed in a completely different landscape.

dayInfo.title: Ambergris Caye – Departure
dayInfo.description: From the villa, it will be a short ride to the airport and a 15-minute domestic flight back to Belize City. From here, you will transfer to the international airport and connect with your homebound flight.

tourName: The Hidden World of the Maya: An Immersive Archaeology Tour of Belize
placesVisited: Belize City, Lamanai National Park, Lamanai, Altun Ha, Cahal Pech, Xunantunich, Caracol, Dangriga, Punta Gorde, Lubaantun, Nim Li Punit, Cayo District
generalInfo: Immerse yourself into the hidden world of the Mayas and live like an explorer. Follow jungle rivers and trails as you travel through Belize’s lost Maya world where the legacy lives on and remains continue to be excavated. Howler monkeys guard epic pyramids, the mystery is etched into tombs, and you will live out a distinctive time and space. Expertly guided and handcrafted, this archaeological tour will take you beyond the standard narratives and into a civilization that delights and inspires.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – An Inspiring Jungle Journey
dayInfo.description: Cruising down New River is a thrilling introduction to Belize. You will touch down at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport and then transfer north to where the road ends. A speedboat takes you further, past soaring ospreys and northern jacanas that flutter across the water. You will feel a sense of archaeological adventure, the boat taking you deep into mostly uncharted territory. Passing all manner of birdlife, you will travel to Lamanai National Park where a spacious wooden cabin hangs over a peaceful lagoon. This is deep into the Belizean rainforest, miles from any road. Check-in, check out the smells and embrace the feeling this small country can create. Head out on a sunset cruise this evening, traveling at a slower speed that helps you get to know the birds a little better. The jacanas appear to walk on water, gray-necked wood rails are found along the banks, and the hawk you think you see is probably a snail kite. Cocktails are served as you watch the birds flutter, then after dinner back at the lodge, you will settle into the landscape’s atmosphere. It will be dark all around, but exotic sounds and smells keep you company, just as they would have done for the Mayas here three millennia ago.

dayInfo.title: Lamanai – Exploring a Maya City With 3000 Years of History
dayInfo.description: Lamanai takes you back to the early days of Maya civilization. An expert guide will lead you around the site to reveal the artifacts and temples while also providing an insight into the archaeological process. Some Lamanai excavations provide evidence that the Maya were here around 1500 B.C. Written records show that Catholic priests arrived in Lamanai in 1641, suggesting the city was inhabited for over 3,000 years. The setting is majestic, and you will bask in the seclusion as there is only likely to be a handful of other visitors in the entire site. First, take a walk around and through the city for an excellent way to orientate with how Maya cities were laid out. You can spend more time at the detailed pieces, such as intricately carved stelae commemorating Lord Smoking Shell, just one of the intriguing art pieces you find carved into the walls, another being 17th-century stelae, constructed some 1,000 years after the face of Lord Smoking Shell. With this in-depth archaeological tour, you will not rush any of the sites. Take your time at this city in the jungle, and take a packed lunch to eat on the temple steps. Returning to the lodge, you will have a quiet afternoon and evening, with the option for a wildlife hike seeking out howler monkeys.

dayInfo.title: Belize City – The First Maya Site to be Excavated in Belize
dayInfo.description: Scores of pyramids rise around the two plazas of Altun Ha, a Classic Period Maya city that has been abandoned for millennia. Although small, it is a city that is rich in detail, as well as being the very first archaeological site to be excavated properly in Belize. Intricate tombs are round within the pyramids, surreal in their elaboration even after most of the jade and precious metal has been removed. Carved blocks are dedicated to the Sun God, K’inich Ahau, with other sculpted figures still being debated by archaeologists. At first glance, everything looks old and overgrown by nature, but with an expert guide you’ will also learn how to distinguish different building eras and picture how Altun Ha would have evolved over 2,000 years. After a morning of archaeology, you will travel to Belize City and a wooden colonial house that has been converted into one of the country’s finest guesthouses. The afternoon and evening are relaxed with the guide able to tailor a walk or cultural visit to your interests.

dayInfo.title: Cayo District – Cultural Histories, Indigenous Animals and Back to the Rainforest
dayInfo.description: Belize Zoo is not a typical zoo. Dedicated to preserving the country’s animal biodiversity, the zoo provides an introduction to various species that have almost disappeared from the world. There are boa constrictors and yellow-headed parrots, tapir, and other 40-odd species that you will learn about from the zoo’s founding director. Before the zoo, your day will begin at Belize Museum, with a narrative on cultural histories that continues the road map from the Maya to today. After the animals, you will travel westwards into Cayo District, and another lodge is hidden in the jungle. Spend several nights here within a nature reserve that makes monkeys your neighbors. There are some good self-guided hiking trails for later in the afternoon, further opportunity to encounter endangered wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Cayo District – Discovering the Maya Cities of Cahal Pech and Xunantunich
dayInfo.description: Cahal Pech commands an idyllic spot above the Maya Mountains, the temples looking out on seemingly endless swathes of forested slopes. Although small, the details are remarkable here. Two separate ball courts are laden with inscriptions, and your guide explains what would have taken place as strangely, a ball match would end in the winning team’s captain being beheaded. Cahal Pech was a royal residence, evidenced by a dreamy hilltop location and the ornamental temples. The site’s archaeological director joins you on your tour to provide exciting information about new finds and evidence. After lunch on the river, you will explore Xunantunich. This towering monument epitomizes the Maya experience in Belize. First, take a hand-cranked ferry to cross the Mopan River, and then hike through the trees for almost 30 minutes. Only now does the city appear, a huge pyramid surging out from a clearing in the trees. A 10-meter stucco frieze covers the facade, constructed 1,100 years ago at a time when much of the Maya world was falling apart. Rising some 40 meters, the pyramid remains the second-highest structure in the country. What is the tallest? You’ll find out tomorrow.

dayInfo.title: Cayo District – A Thrilling Day at Caracol
dayInfo.description: Caracol is deep in the rainforest and accessed along a dirt road that is closed to anyone without permits. You will weave through the trees before approaching the city’s outskirts and then continue on foot through a site of baffling scale. This city covers a space that is far larger than modern Belize City and was home to over 180,000 people at its peak. It was the most powerful of all the region’s cities, a political kingpin that fought against or allied with others in Central America. In particular, Caracol overthrew Tikal’s warlords in the Snake Kingdom wars, and you will spend the whole day in Caracol, and you could probably spend an entire week and still not see everything. Moss-covered plazas appear in rainforest openings as monkey troops swing above the trail as you walk to pyramids. Intricate stelae are admired along with excavations that detail the sheer size of the city. An innovative reservoir system remains intact and still carries water into the city, some 1,500 years after it was finished. Keep exploring, and you cannot miss the sky palace, a towering pyramid that contains three temples and four palaces. Ascend the steps, and you stand on top of this pyramid, which remains the tallest building in the whole of Belize. While Maya pyramids may be even taller in neighboring Mexico and Guatemala, none are as bulbous and visually inspiring as this sky palace, the centerpiece of an epic lost city in the jungle.

dayInfo.title: Punta Gorda – Garifuna Cultural Encounters and a Jungle Lodge
dayInfo.description: Drive along the Hummingbird Highway to Dangriga where you will meet the Garifuna, an intriguing ethnic group that came to Belize from West Africa via the Caribbean. A local takes you on a tour of the Gulisi Garifuna Museum, narrating a history that is proud and poignant. After lunch, you will continue south for an afternoon on white beaches, a quiet interlude to all the history and archaeology. Complete your journey by crossing a river and returning to the jungle, where your lodge has a location like the others within a nature reserve that teems with wildlife. Check-in and head out on one of the walking trails, or sit back on the balcony and arouse different senses.

dayInfo.title: Punta Gorda – The Mystery of Lubaantun and Nim Li Punit
dayInfo.description: Jungle engulfed, the Maya Mountains set the scene on this final archaeological day in Belize. Stone terraces stand beneath the canopy as javelins of light pierce through to illuminate the intricate facades. Carved stone monuments further celebrate the artisanal style of the Maya, including an 11-meter stelae that still stands tall. You will visit two sites today beginning with Lubaantun. Lubaantun was a ceremonial center, constructed completely without mortar, a style that is distinctive in southern Belize. Nearby Nim Li Punit is also from the Late Classic Period, and you will immediately see how it gets its name as a stone-carved flowing headdress dominates one of the monoliths, with Nim Li Punit translating as “Big Hat” in English. These two sites provide the fitting culmination to everything that has gone before, a mix of captivating stories, newly excavated finds, and the innovation of the Maya.

dayInfo.title: Belize City – Departure
dayInfo.description: From the rainforest, you will wave farewell to the howler monkeys and return to Belize City, where you will have some free time to go shopping before your international departure.

tourName: Tropical Beaches to Lush Jungle: Beautiful Belize Escape
placesVisited: Belize, Toledo District, Placencia Peninsula, Belize Barrier Reef
generalInfo: On this 8-day tour, enjoy what is best of Belize, from the stunning natural beauty of the famous barrier reef to the heights of the impressive Mayan ruins at Xunantunich. Perched on the eastern edge of the Yucatan Peninsula, Belize remains a top destination for those visiting Central America. By the time the sun sets on your adventures, Belize will leave you charmed and wanting more.

dayInfo.title: Rainforest Lodge – Welcome to the Jungle
dayInfo.description: Belize is the perfect setting for a tropical getaway because it offers spectacular weather in addition to a rich cultural heritage. Perched on the eastern side of the famous Yucatan Peninsula, the country provides a laid-back alternative to some of its more populous neighbors. After your arrival at Belize's main international airport, you will make your way to a rainforest lodge and into the heart of the Maya mountains. After your arrival, you will have the remainder of the day to explore your lush accommodation and surrounding area.

dayInfo.title: Rainforest Lodge – The Savory Side of Belize
dayInfo.description: Although the official language of Belize is English, Kriol is widely spoken throughout the country. The cosmopolitan nature of this country can also be seen in the culinary traditions that locals proudly practice. On your first morning in Belize, you will be able to partake in a cooking experience that will allow you to take a stab at learning the secrets of ancient Maya recipes and ingredients under the guidance of an authentic and professional Maya chef.

dayInfo.title: Rainforest Lodge – The Mayan Ruins of Xunantunich
dayInfo.description: The rich archaeological record shown in Belize dates back to 1,500 BC, and the country was once home to the region's most advanced Pre-Colombian civilization. Into this rich history you will step on a tour of the ruins of Xunantunich, which are situated in the heart of the jungle near your accommodations. As you visit the excavated structures and pause in the shadow of some of Belize's largest Mayan temples, you will have a chance to ponder the societies that once populated this lush landscape from your comfortable vantage point.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – The Five Blues Lake Region
dayInfo.description: In addition to being known for some outstanding pre-Columbian ruins, Belize is home to an amazing abundance of natural beauty and biodiversity. The country's raw natural attractions will be well on display during your kayaking adventure along the Five Blues Lake. In this world of carved river canyons and stunning scenic caves, you will float your way through the local flora and fauna. For this excursion, you will be led by an experienced guide. After an active day in nature, you will transfer to your new accommodation in Placencia. Here, you will be able to relax for the remainder of the day.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Dip Below the Waves
dayInfo.description: Belize is teeming with marine life and coastal beauty, and a trip here is not complete without enjoying the beautiful seaside communities that lie along its storied coastline. On your first day in Placencia, you will be able to enjoy a visit to the world's second-largest reef complex during a snorkeling excursion. As you venture from spot to spot along the Silk Cayes Marine Reserve, this aquatic playground will be yours to explore. Afterward, you will return to the resort to relax and enjoy your tropical surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Products of the Cocoa Plant
dayInfo.description: As you learned while sampling traditional Mayan gastronomy earlier on this tour, Belize is a country full of savory treats and outstanding culinary creations. Today, you can enjoy a comfortable transfer into Belize's famous Toledo district. Here, you will observe the cozy relationship between Belize and the cocoa plant. Central America has long been a major producer of chocolate, and this unique corner is no different. This chocolate-making tradition is something you will enjoy with a chocolate-sampling experience. In the afternoon, you will be able to visit some of the region's best swimming holes.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Charting Your Own Course
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in this spectacular country will be yours to enjoy at your leisure. Since you will be situated at the juncture of land and sea, there will be an abundance of active and passive options from which you can choose. Perhaps, a visit to the local town will help you find that perfect souvenir. You can also enjoy a two-wheeled cruise along the Placencia peninsula that will allow you to feel the brisk Caribbean air on your face. From bowling to kayaking, there is no shortage of adventures for you. Regardless of how you choose to spend the day, you will always be able to recline in this tropical climate and enjoy an afternoon of relaxation.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Completing Your Belizean Adventure
dayInfo.description: On your final day in Belize, you will enjoy a delicious breakfast. As the sun climbs higher in the sky, you will have some final moments to enjoy this tropical environment before meeting your transfer. Soon you will be on your way to the nearby domestic airport and your ultimate departure for home. As your guides have indicated, there will still be so much to see and experience in this unique corner of the Caribbean.

tourName: Unforgettable Honeymoon in Belize: Romance & Adventure
placesVisited: San Ignacio, Placencia Peninsula, Placencia, Xunantunich, Cockscomb Wildlife Sanctuary
generalInfo: Belize is a tropical delicacy brimming with romantic delights and ineffable adventure. Colorful toucans perch on the jungle tree branches. Waterfalls cascade inside limestone caves. Jaguars skulk through the forest underbrush in search of their next meal. Coral glows underneath the crystal-clear water. The soft sand on the beaches feels inviting between your toes. Mayan temples rise above the treetops like ancient skyscrapers. Manta rays glide along the seafloor with elegant movement. Your tour is custom tailored to immerse you in the unforgettable wonder of Belize, from the trees to the coast, romantic candlelit dinners to sunset cruises.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Love at First Sight
dayInfo.description: Your first image of Belize comes when you look out the window during your flight’s descent. The emerald treetops rush to the edges of the turquoise Caribbean Sea. You can feel the tropical sun warming your skin already. The flight lands at Philip S.W. Goldson International Airport. Check-in to your local flight which will take you to the Cayo District Airport near San Ignacio. You soon arrive in the western jungles of Belize. Lush trees border the runway along the hillside. A wide, gravel-paved avenue leads from the main road to the resort. The verdant landscape welcomes you first and foremost to Belize. The nearby city of San Ignacio has a vibrant center with a gracious, inviting atmosphere filled with bustling markets, and locals spanning the Belizean cultural spectrum from Maya to Mestizos, Garifuna to free-spirit expatriates. A private transfer greets you at the airport upon your arrival and helps with your bags. Cows graze in the undulating hills beyond the tree line. Howler monkeys hide in the canopy. The concierge of the resort greets you and your partner with a glass of fresh berry juice made with produce grown on the local organic farm. You press the cool peppermint towel to your cheeks and neck. The aroma and temperatures of the fabric helps refresh you after traveling. In your room, you can relax with your partner and settle in to the amorous sounds of the secluded jungle.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Sharing the Adventure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the light glints into the butterfly farm sparkling with the iridescent blue patterns of the blue morpho butterfly. Water from the infinity pool spills into a small pond. The trickling sound echoes across the walkway, leading to the thatched-roof restaurant for breakfast. The sound imitates the nearby river rushing along the banks, outlining the property. After breakfast, you meet your guide near the lobby, ready to share in the adventure of a waterfall cave expedition. Travel along a portion of the Hummingbird Highway, the most beautiful road in Belize. The lush jungle trees overtake the foothills and mountains. The aroma of oranges and limes emanates from the citrus groves along the highway. You reach the trailhead and trek to the mouth of a cave winding hundreds of feet under the limestone mountain. You and your partner put on helmets equipped with headlamps before venturing into the depths of the cavern. The sound of rushing water echoes off of the limestone walls. The rugged texture of the cave turns smooth the closer you come to the reverberating hums of the river. The water meanders through the cave, trundling down into natural pools along six separate waterfalls. Crystal formations sparkle in the passing light. On your way out of the caves, you and your partner jump without fear into the natural pools, splashing with the cascades. After lunch, you make your way from subterranean adventurers to treetop explorers on a zip line excursion. Travel along 15 platforms for a total of 2,700 feet. You feel at home the moment you glide through the air and feel the wind rushing against your cheeks.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Uncovering the Past
dayInfo.description: When morning washes over the resort, the emerald gleam of the surrounding leaves resembles precious stones. You and your partner indulge in the seclusion of your accommodation and the private view from your deck. An iguana scampers across the grass in the early light. Its impressive size can reach a total of six feet long, including its hardy tail. In the trees, you spot a collared aracari, a type of toucan with a brightly marked bill. Yellow and red plumage shine along the bird’s chest resembling licking flames against its black back. After breakfast, you meet your guide for an excursion to the Mayan city of Xunantunich. You can choose to follow the trails leading to the historic site or drive in a private car. A hand-cranked ferry takes you across the Mopan River. The city sits on a leveled hilltop. Archeologists believe the city’s genesis as a village began around 1000 BC. The architecture you see before you dates around the 7th century AD. Around Plaza A-3, you find outlines of the former residential palace, an area designated to the ruling family. El Castillo, a pyramid rising 130 feet tall, making it the second largest structure in the country, edges the south end of Plaza A-1. The friezes depict the birth and formation of distinct gods correlated with the royal family. Your guide encourages you and your partner to climb to the top of El Castillo. You have a 360-degree view of Xunantunich and the stucco frieze encircling the building. From the top of the pyramid, you and your partner have the best view in Belize. You grab each other’s hands and absorb the private moment.

dayInfo.title: San Ignacio – Following Natural Wonder
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you sip your freshly roasted coffee and listen to the birds twittering in the trees. A blue-crowned motmot perches on a branch near the open restaurant. Indigo plumage around its eyes accentuates the black feathers near the bill. You notice the dangling tail feather that resembles two tufts. Your guide greets you at the welcome area and escorts you once again along the Hummingbird Highway to the trailheads at Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary. The preserve encompasses 200 square miles of protected land, and is located in the eastern Maya Mountains. Animals are most active in the early mornings due to the cool temperature. Howler monkeys call out to one another in the canopy. Their rugged hollering sounds Jurassic. Their calls can be heard from up to three miles away. An estimated 50 jaguars, along with an exciting array of other animals, bird, and botanical life, make their home in the sanctuary. On the trail, you quickly spot a brock deer grazing on leaves and fruits. Their stout bodies emphasize their large ears. Later on the trail, you find fresh jaguar tracks leading into the jungle brush. The leaves rustle and your heart jumps into your throat wondering if a jaguar will soon leap over the bushes. Instead your guide points into the tree where a scarlet macaw nibbles on shoots. Their long, red tail feathers resemble streamers.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – A Beachside Romance
dayInfo.description: Throughout the day, guests of the resort reserve kayaks and float down the Macal River. The cool water revitalizes your energy in the warmth of the tropical jungle. This morning, you meet your private transfer early to make your brief flight, taking you from the Cayo District to Placencia Peninsula located in southeast Belize. Lush trees frame the runway on either side leading to the radiant blue water of the Caribbean Sea. You and your partner marvel at the various shades of blue glowing from the shore to the horizon. Your private transfer meets you at the airport and escorts you to your resort located on the beach. Palm trees shade the sand. Your concierge leads you to a secluded room with a private deck looking out to the water. The remainder of the day is yours to relax with the stunning view of the water at your disposal. Sit on a lounge chair and listen to the crashing waves. Dig your toes into the hot sand. You and your partner can step out to the bar located at the end of the pier. The breeze flows through the open walls, bringing the salty aroma of the sea beneath the thatched roof. The bartender blends fresh pineapple into a special cocktail welcoming you to the soothing atmosphere of the Caribbean.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Beauty of the Blue and In the Blue
dayInfo.description: In the early morning, you can look out on the horizon and watch the sun rise over the eastern edges of the Caribbean Sea. The waves hit the shore. The gentle breeze rustles through the palm fronds. The sunlight peels across the water, adding layers of pink and orange above the turquoise surface of the sea. Today you step aboard a boat and venture out on a full day tour to the famous Great Blue Hole. The submarine sinkhole is located near Lighthouse Reef, a small atoll. The hole has a diameter of 984 feet and reaches a depth of 407 feet. Blacktip sharks and reef sharks swim around the coral reefs, which connects to the greater Barrier Reef, the second largest reef in the world. Whether snorkeling along the coral or scuba divining into the depths of the natural formation, you will find treasures of marine life and natural history. The rich blue contrasts the surrounding lighter hues. Triggerfish and angelfish meander around the brain coral and waving sea fans. When scuba diving, you can swim down to see the cave walls, peering through the dark blue water until the limestone columns light up your view. It resembles an upside-down forest but instead of trees, you find stalactites. When venturing into the deep, your search turns from marine life to the sparse cave system, decorated with fascinating geological formations. You and your partner witness the grand architecture of a natural cathedral sunk beneath the sea.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – Passionate as leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you sip a refreshing cup of coffee and listen to the waves once again. No matter how long you stay in Placencia, you and your partner will always find the sound of the water soothing and sensual. After breakfast, the day is yours to enjoy Placencia and the surrounding beauty of Belize at your leisure. Visit nearby islands on a sailboat excursion. Kayak along the mangrove forest at Laughing Bird Caye. Return to the Barrier Reef for more time snorkeling in search of turtles and sharks. The endless splendor of Belize is at your whim and pleasure. For a unique adventure, you and your partner make your way to Monkey River for a return visit to the verdant jungle. You begin at the mouth of the river at Monkey River Village, a peaceful town in the Toledo District. Fishermen float down the river with large lobster traps waving to you as they pass. Once on the skiff, you travel up river on a tranquil tour in search of the resident wildlife. Mangrove trees grow along the mouth of the river. Large toucans poke their red-tipped bills out from the trees. Your guide points to a crocodile basking in the warmth of the sun-drenched bank. The relaxed ambiance of your river safari allows you and your partner to relish the wonder of Belize, from the fishing culture to the jungle atmosphere. Your guide drifts past a bank and cuts a piece of sugarcane for you and your partner to snack on.

dayInfo.title: Placencia – A Loving Encounter
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you take in one more sunrise with your partner, watching the colors wash over the turquoise Caribbean. You imagine the vibrant seafloor covered in glowing coral and active with schools of fish. You can practically hear the howler monkeys calling in the jungle trees. At breakfast, you and your partner reminisce on your favorite moments between the luxurious rooms to the unforgettable wilds. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you the Placencia airport for your brief flight to Belize City. After your arrival, you check-in to your return flight home, waving farewell to your adventure in Belize, but taking the romance with you.
